description:
Went to SF for my husband's birthday and to visit with my family.  It was a weekday and my brother-in-law picked us up at the airport at 9am as we caught the first flight out to SF.  BIL asks if we want to go to brunch, "there's this whole-in-the-wall place that I go to all the time, its CHEAP and its really good too!" He's saying all the right things and of course, we're in, plus this gives us quality time to spend with him before he drops us off at his house to run errands.

Because of the time of day, we make it from the airport to the restaurant in 15-minutes.  Street parking is the only option as this is a neighborhood joint. People walk from their homes, school and nearby businesses to feast here.  Because this is BIL's frequent stop, we park at the Safeway across the street and like city folk, we jay-walk.

So we walk in and I look up at the menu and exclaimed how cheap it was as the lunch special beef broccoli was only $3.75! So my BIL was like, no you can't order from there, order from here and points to the menu on the front window of the counter. Which was still a good deal. I opted for the longanisa plate at $3.75 while my BIL got bangus (fish) and my husband got the tilapia plates.  Including, coffee, our bill was $17.  Cash is king here.

Service was quick.  My husband went to the market next door to check it out and in less than 2-minutes, our meals were delivered. And the food was good too. I've never had a sliced tomato with longanisa before. Of course my BIL enjoyed his meal as he orders it all the time and my husband did a great job of digging into the tilapia as they serve the entire fish.

But I still wondered why I couldn't order from the menu up above.  My BIL says that the menu has been hanging there for the past 30-years and through the different owners. They just haven't taken it down or removed any of the menu items or the prices. It's quirky but makes for a good story.

My BIL told us that this place gets busy at lunch because the high school kids at the school nearby come here for lunch.  And sure enough, 10:30 am, 8 people came in all at the same time.  The restaurant is small, so the 8th person in line stood at the very entrance of the restaurant.  If a 9th person came, they would be standing in line outside the entrance.

The city in the older suburb areas has many of these type of restaurants. This certainly made for a great start to this visit to SF.
author: Edith S.

description:
My Second visit here after hearing a lot of hype from my colleagues... My first time about a year or 2 ago wasnt that memorable... So let start fresh from what i ordered today... 

Boneless fish over garlic rice... It comes with 4 chunks of pineapple  and over easy egg...

Garlic Rice 5/10
Boneless Fish 5/10

The only Positive when you see their menu, all menu items are so affordable. Pricewise, I gave them 10/10.. and thats the only reason I can give this merchant a 3/5 Stars...
author: Dedy G.

description:
Superstar Restaurant is just a few blocks away from its sister restaurant, Gateway Kitchen. Gateway is closer to my place but since it was closed on a Monday, it was an opportunity to give Superstar a try. 
I was glad I did go the extra mile because I thought Superstar was a bit cleaner. I mean yeah it is small and old like Gateway but the kitchen, floor tiles and windows look cleaner to me. 

Anyway, I really like their HK style porkchop. It is 2 pc of porkchop that is battered and fried to crisp. For $4.75, it comes with lots of garlic rice, 1 egg and a choice of tomato or pineapple. I have tried their tocino and bangus but HK pork really is their best seller! 
Pork fatty crispy goodness for that once in a while cholesterol craving! 

P.S. - Come to Superstar instead if you like tomatoes. Gateway only serves pineapples.
author: Nice C.

description: Super cheap and tasty rice plates. Ordered the pork chops Hong Kong style, added longanisa, and got it with tomatoes and pineapples. The food was busting out of the box. The pork chops were thin and super fried. Would probably just get the longanisa next time and perhaps try the other items. With a coconut drink, meal came out to be less than $11.
author: Tina S.

description: The front says Chinese Fast Food, but it is Filipino food.  I had spamsilog and bangsilog (they had 3 different kinds: regular with bone, baby bangus, and boneless smoked).  Less then $11 for both.  Don't be thrown off by the plain front facade.  Inside is good cheap eats!
author: Anthony A.

description: Update: still hella freakin love this place!! I officially like this place more than Gateway.. yes I know it's the same thing but this place just does it better. The rice taste better and for some reason the batter on their Hong Kong style porkchops is better too! I also like how they serve "sabaw" (soup) with the meals now.. not sure how much extra it cost but it adds on to the Filipino type meal. Location wise, the seating is better and more spacious, less dirty looking too lol. But yeah, still can't beat the price and portions at both places.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Talk about a bang for your buck! Any of your favorite Silogs (garlic fried rice, egg, side of pineapple or tomato, and choice of meat) for under $5... Can't beat that.

My favorite here is the Hong Kong style pork chop. The pork is battered and fried to a beautifully crunchy golden brown. This as your meat choice in your silog comes with 2 pretty large pork chops! 

Been coming here for years now and staff hasn't changed. The tall guy at the front is always so cheerful and inviting.
author: Mary R.

description: I can't believe I never been here before!!! I always wanted a nice, delicious Filipino breakfast but didn't know where to go -- but i do now! I came in here on a Friday morning just before 9am, ordered two longanisas meal to go and it's delicious!!! Super affordable and it's a small comfy restaurant. Would definitely come back here again for breakfast!
author: Sandy C.

description: Hongkong style pork chops, well-done fried egg, oily garlic fried rice, and a side of tomato slices at $5 and change is a guilty pleasure I succumb to once in a while. For sure I have eaten better tasting pork chops at home but hey, this one is instant gratification about 10 minutes after ordering.
author: Irene B.

description:
Large quantity for a low low price! This is what you call a hole-in-the-wall.  Many of these items on the menu are under $5!

I ordered the order with popcorn chicken, garlic rice, side of pineapple/ tomato, egg, and coffee/ tea. In another order, it was the same combo only with longanisa. This took maybe 15 mins since it was also lunch time. When the orders came, it was huge! The portion sizes for that price is so worth it and a huge plus!

The restaurant from the outside to the inside is worn down, small, and old but the food and service makes up for it! Definitely come try this place out!
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
Superstar is another good classic hood spot. If you're on a budget or just feel like getting some good Filipino food, go here. All the plates are $5 or less. You get your money's worth no doubt about it! 

4 stars because it's not the cleanest restaurant. But it's not so dirty as to scare you out the door. If you can get past the tough exterior, you will see the food is surprisingly good! I will be back.
author: Manny R.

description:
Superstar has been in the excelsior district for as long as I can remember. One of the local favorites, known for its delicious cheap food. A small hole in the wall that has the same interior since forever! (Literally, the seats are the same they have the same holes I remember when I was younger lol) 

Superstars most popular dish is the Hong Kong style pork chop. For around $5, you get two very large Hong Kong style pork chops with garlic fried rice and tomato or pineapple. The portions are HUGE you really get the bang for your buck. Hong Kong style pork chops are the delicious greasy food you crave after a long drunk night out. It will definitely recover you from your horrible hang over. I highly recommend. 

My second fave is the longsilog. With 2 or 3 longanisas, garlic fried rice and tomato or pineapple, it's a child favorite of mine. If you haven't tried the sweet and savory red sausages called longanisa yet, you have to try! 

Although superstar doesn't have the beautiful ambiance, locals love this place for the food and it pretty much speaks for itself.
author: AJ C.

description:
I grew up eating this food. It's a small mom & pop style restaurant known for their Filipino silog dishes even though it's run by Chinese folks. What are silog dishes? Your choice of protein, garlic fried rice, and an egg all for a very reasonable price around $4-5. Cheap eats I tell ya!

When in doubt, go for the HONG KONG STYLE PORK CHOP. Also, you can choose between tomatoes or pineapples as a side to cut through the grease. I recommend picking up the food because the restaurant is dark and cramped.
author: Christene M.

description:
The restaurant is actually a hole in a way. It is right across from Safeway. If you can't find it stand in front of Safeway and look across the street. This is one of my favorite places to go for a quick and cheap meal. It is a Chinese/Filipino restaurant. They are the sweetest people ever. Service is ok, a standard quick service restaurant. It is not the prettiest place and there are not a lot of tables but the food is amazing. They make the food quick and it gets very busy during lunch. People usually order to go. 

They have huge portions and everything is around $5 and under. They have Filipino breakfasts for around $3.50. I like the Hong Kong style porkchop, tapsilog, fried chicken, and bangus (it has bones). Each meal comes with garlic rice, fried egg, and either chopped tomato or pineapples.
author: Michelle C.

description: I was trying to get breakfast for my bf and I early in the morning but our usual spot was not open for some reason so i resorted to this place. My friend told me that it was basically the same as my usual so I decided to give it a shot. The price was fair but the food was not good. I ordered the longanisa and the tacino.... The tacino tasted so weird and gross that my bf didnt even want to eat it. Normally tacino is suppose to be rich in dark red color but it was pale brown... the longanisa literally just tasted like a filipino hot dog that you put in the spaghetti. Im a huge fan on longanisa and it didnt taste like it what so ever. I will not be going back to this location.
author: Samantha W.

description: Cheapest lunch plate you'll find! Plates usually run about ~$5.00. I will always come back to this hole in the wall.
author: Ardee A.

description:
5 stars for EPIC and CHEAP meals !! 

Who wouldn't want Topsilog w/ Extra Rice and a side Soup (Beef Broth) for like $6.50?! 

#WIN

The place is not clean like most people look for, and the the service maybe too quick and because of it folks/workers can be considered "Rude". But we must remember that when t comes to the requests of our stomachs, it is all about the TASTE and the QUALITY! 

If you grew up Struggling Financially, Lived in the Ghetto, or had a hard time trying to find a way to survive, food places like here is what you would call LUXURY! :) 

Like I said, the Customer Service or Cleanliness of the place is not all that great, but in terms of QUANTITY and TASTE plus the PRICING of the food, it is a STRAIGHT UP WIN if you know how to be THANKFUL !!
author: Erito S.

description: I been going to this place since I was little . I never really appreciate this place until I got older . Filipino breakfast and it's cheap and it's very fulfilling.  The place is pretty small and street parking ..
author: Ciara F.

description:
Hubby took me while on our vacay to nor cal. He has been talking about this place for years. ( he used to live in San Fran). 
I have to admit the food is bomb ! The area is a bit sketchy, parking is bad. And if you eat your to go food there, they will charge you. Lol. No biggie. Still worth it. Wish we can find somewhere in Oc that has their hong kong style pork chops but I doubt we will ever be able to find somewhere comparable !
author: J J.

description:
Forever a gem in my heart!!!! 
You have to order the Hong Kong style pork chops with a side order of friend chicken. Their prices are still hard to beat and the quality of food never changed since I was a kid. If you like Filipino style breakfast... come and patronize this joint.
author: Summer M.

description:
If anyone needs their fix of a Filipino breakfast, I would suggest you to make your way out to the city asap. I travel all the way from the East Bay to get my favorite, Hong Kong style pork chops. 

If you thought that your local Filipino restaurant had delicious food, you were mistaken. This restaurant may not be the best looking, but looks can be deceiving sometimes! It's a hole in the wall restaurant that only locals know about. From their longanisa, to the tocino, to the pork chops, to the fish, etc... Everything is amazing.

When I first went there, I never thought that I would've enjoyed the food so much. They cook everything perfectly. The pork chops are never dry or over cooked, the longanisa and tocino is juicy, the fried rice isn't too salty. The prices and portions are another favorite of mine! For a plate of your liking, its about $3-$5 at the most. The portions are huge. If you can't finish your brunch, you can always take it to go and it still tastes the same or even better later! I usually order the hong kong style pork chops with a scrambled egg, rice, and tomatoes on the side. I dip my porkchops in vinegar and soy sauce. 

If you're ever in the mission and come across this restaurant, do not sleep on them! If I lived closer, I would probably be there every morning if I could. The only day they are closed, are Sunday's, so make sure you have your back up to go for that day if you're craving needs to be filled.
author: Adrianna T.

description:
4 Star for Superstar
FOOD IS GOOD! 
Servings is alot cant go wrong on this place.. 
fave is Bangsilog (boneless Milkfish) & porkchop
its cheap and Delicious 

the location by top of the hill chef & server are the most friendliest Chinese server i have ever encountered lol..

The missing Star is for the Place, i wish they move to a bigger and cleaner place that is all.
author: Prinxez L.

description: For the price, this place cant be beat.  Hk pork chops n the salty eggs are my favorite.  If your hungry for greasy food and short on cash this is the place for you lol.
author: Hugh L.

description: I'd consider this restaurant to be another hidden gem. The food is very delicious and their service is fast and easy. I ordered the Hong Kong style pork chop with a side of salted egg and I really enjoyed it! I would definitely come back here again! I recommend this to anyone looking for some authentic Filipino food.
author: Cenon M.

description:
When it comes to affordable food, this is the place to be. For full meals under $5, you will not be disappointed. Food entrees include filipino breakfast which is priced at $3.50 and I believe the most popular dish would be the hong kong style pork chops for $4.50. The meal includes 2-3 large pieces of pork chops, garlic fried rice, a pan fried egg and a choice of either pineapple pieces or tomato chunks. 

However, the food here is unhealthy. Everything is drenched with grease and the food options are pretty much similar basic food items mixed and match. This is something I would come here once in a while but not on a regular. Also the business hours are limited. Weekdays, it closes at 430pm and on Sunday it is closed all day. I think this would be a great location for the late night munchies.
author: Auden W.

description:
cheap. delicious. fatty. san francisco staple. pardon me- san francisco native staple. 
hong kong style porkchops are the best. bangus silog if you like fish!!!
it's a hole in the wall so don't expect anything fancy but do expect a bargain for your buck!!!
author: Marian B.

description:
Wow!
What a place to get good low priced Pinoy food.
The staff are the original workers who cooks and serves the food.
They are super friendly and fast!
I love this place!
author: adam b.

description:
Beef Tapa is my favorite ! Garlic Fried Rice , egg n tomatoes.  ONLY  $ 3.75 !!! 
BEST VALUE ANYWHERE. 
Food tastes great n even if you only think it's ok for 3.75 it can't be denied as a must buy.
WINNER ! MUST GO.
author: Pure M.

description:
I was skeptical at first that the items were _too_ cheap: surely these must be appetizers, or really small portions? So I ordered 5 things for pickup to feed 3, just in case.

I could not have been more wrong- we ordered a feast! A very cheap feast. $20ish and we ate well for lunch and dinner.

The menu is quite simple: pretty much entirely garlic fried rice + egg + [insert meat/fish option] + tomato or pineapple. We ordered a pork chop, fish, chicken, beef and cured pork. Of those, the winners for us were the pork chop and chicken. Those dishes also happened to be the most generous portion sizes. 

It is a bit greasy and salty (which seems on par for the cuisine, not their fault) so it's probably not a regular stop for my health's sake, but definitely on my list when I'm craving a big, flavorful meal on the cheap.
author: Krista L.

description:
It makes me sad that this place is only open till 4, but regardless this place is amazing.

Homestyle filipino cooking and crazy cheap!! Great for a quick breakfast or lunch and the service is super quick!!
author: Nicole N.

description:
Cheap, fast, good, and the portion is more than what you pay for- very good thing! This place has been for years, I always go for the Hong Kong style porkchop with tomatoes, egg, and garlic rice. 

I high recommend and suggest you try this place for Filipino breakfast!
author: Regina Rose S.

description: This is a cheap eat place but if you like Filipino food must be good food to you, but am not familiar with Filipino food and ordered a meal they said is fish, think is fish skin, I should have asked before place my order.  The food came, it was fish skin deep fry with some rice.  For me, it is hard to eat but to some maybe is good.  I am not fuss over it after all only $5.50, I left it unfinished. I see lots of people come in, so this must be a good place just that you need to know what to orders.
author: Kitty L.

description: This is a little whole in the wall Chinese restaurant that's know for serving Filipino food! This place isn't at all the nicest place too eat but the lady at the register is super nice a patient,  but they got some good food for really good price! I got the Hong Kong Style fried Porkchops which came with an egg and rice. My wife got the tapsilog which was pretty dry I don't recommend, and my daughter got the spamsilog which is hard to mess up lol! I spent less than $14 and my wallet was happy for that. They also serve regular Chinese food here too but I didn't try it, everything is cooked to order so it's fresh too! Anyways for what it is 4 stars for this place.
author: Elvin D.

description:
I love this place! Before you go, remember to bring some cash and some coins to pay for the meter on the street. The portions are HUGE for the price - it's literally hella cheap. I always go for the hong kong style porkchops with occasional side of tapa. This comes with garlic rice, an over easy egg, and you have the choice of tomatoes or pineapples. I recommend getting it with the pineapples though! You have to dip the hong kong style porkchops using the sauces provided on the table: vinegar, soy sauce, and salt/pepper. I usually just mix the vinegar and soy sauce together and it tastes sooooooo gooooooood! 

You shouldn't expect to enter some nice restaurant - it isn't the best in terms of cleanliness, but their food definitely makes up for it! It's a really small restaurant that seats about 10-15 people, so most people take it to go. If you do order to go and you eat it inside, they charge an extra fee. 

I somehow always crave Superstar when it's closed.....on Sundays. I definitely have to make a stop by here sometime soon because I haven't had it in a while and I'm craving it!!
author: Sydney C.

description: Still the same as I remember when I use to work in the city 8 years ago! Great complete meals for a great price! Have to try it at least once. Hole in the wall! Always the best places!
author: Jose R.

description: It was my first time to eat there in their restaurant BUT it was a disaster store. As you enter the restaurant, all the tables and chairs are not clean. All the condiments are not also clean wherein you will see the bottles are very dirty. Their menus are not presentable to the customers every time they will place their orders. You will see a lot of papers and other things are inside their see through cabinets as you place your order. There is no special when it comes to their food even if the price is cheap.
author: Darem A.

description: Crispy and delicious fried pork chops with garlic fried rice. Cheap and filling. Probably not healthy but was good to eat.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
A true hole-in-the-wall type of restaurant! This place is tiny and hidden under the sign from next door. I've passed by here many times but never seen it. I decided to try it out when I found it on yelp!
There were any tables open when we got there but one cleared out pretty quickly. The menu is a little confusing, we were looking for the filipino-style breakfast and it was on a paper menu hanging in front of the counter. The food took about 15minutes to come out, which isn't too bad. 
Longsilog ($3.50) came with longanisa, garlic fried rice, egg, and tomato (or pineapple). The longanisa was really good and it came with a decent amount of food at a really great price! Next time I would get two more pieces of longanisa for $2.50 extra. 
Tapsilog ($3.75) came with beef tapa, garlic fried rice, egg, and tomato or pineapple. I really liked the beef. It was thinly sliced and perfectly cooked! I loved the garlic fried rice and the over-easy egg was perfect. They didn't ask how we wanted the egg cooked but I like my eggs over-easy so I don't have any complaints!
I have to come back to try the Hong Kong-style pork chops that everyone talks about! The food here is good at a great price!
author: Emily L.

description: I used to live here in south city 16 years ago use to come to this place all the time after work at FedEx. A buddy of mine took me here and love it since. Moved away been craving it for 16 years finally came back to visit and brought my wife and son and they two agree with me that this place is off the chain wish they had one of these in Orange County. It's great to see nothing's changed as if time stood still Hong Kong style pork chops are the Shiznit's! I left my heart in San Francisco i'm gonna miss you the most superstar Hong Kong style pork chops!
author: Leo J.

description:
A true hidden gem.

If you're craving delicious (Filipino style)  food with great portioning and all under $5, this a must go!

Yelp only allows ratings of 5 stars, but this place for sure deserves more ! Hence their name
author: Derica M.

description:
If I had to chose a meal before I die, this is it. I could eat this every single day. My go-to order is the Hong Kong Style Pork Chop with fried rice, fried egg, and side of either tomato or pineapple.

They actually close at 5pm, not 4:30pm. So you have an extra 30 minutes to race over after work. You can call and place an order too to save yourself some time and bring cash! $5 will get you some good quality food here.
author: Karen C.

description: Been coming here for years and I recommend everyone that is in the area to try out SUPERSTAR. Thank you for the reasonable prices, large quantities, and delicious food. No one can match your garlic fried rice or Hong Kong style pork chops
author: Ryan G.

description:
The absolute cheapest silogs you can find in the area. The dishes are good and hits that spot for it's price of less than $4 (yes...FOUR DOLLARS). A few bucks gets you a decent size cup of garlicky fried rice, a fried egg, your choice of either tomatoes or pineapples and your basic main silog dish; tocino, tapa, bangus, longanisa, tilapia, fried chicken and porkchop.  

Lazy? On a budget? Wanna just grab and go? Superstar is truly a neighborHOOD dive, hole in the wall type drive-by... but they're quick, friendly, cheap and the food is legit....SCORE!
author: Resa N.

description: This secret gem is across from the Safeway on Mission in the Excelsior. It might not look like much, but if often has a line out the door for a reason. I suggest the Hong Kong style pork chop. The value for money is unbeatable, coming in at like $5 for 2 pork chops, rice, pineapple, and a fried egg.
author: sean d.

description: One of the best small family business hole in the wall that serves big generous delicious Filipino/Chinese grub. It's walk-up ordering and cash only for great inexpensive prices. Don't forget to tip the elderly women as servers, and you'll get a grateful smile :)
author: Carmel D.

description: For a small restaurant, this place makes the best fried pork chops ever. I love this place, it seriously does fill you up, I always get Hong Kong style pork chops and a side of longinisa. The customer service is alright, I remember when I asked for some more little sauce containers they were seriously so CHEAP about it? Like why? I just wanted two more. It's so tiny... but overall it's pretty good.
author: Ritney N.

description: This place can get crowded at times but it's so cheap and there is no long wait for your food!! AWSOME service!!!
author: Josh L.

description: so good + cheap! say no more this is it if ur looking for filipino breakfast food this is the perfect place to go
author: Carla N.

description:
Amazing. If I were to choose one word to describe this hole-in-the-wall restaurant that serves primarily Filipino and Hong Kong styled food, it would be amazing. This place is affordable and the portions are gigantic, which is a a huge plus for in college, it will only take about five dollars for you to get completely full here! The food although cheap is very delicious, many if not all the options on the menu are authentic Filipino or Hong Kong style dishes made fresh and quickly for you after you place your order. 
This place also holds a special place in my heart because it was my of choice after a long high school days, even now as I attend college 300+ miles away it still is my restaurant of choice whenever I am back in San Francisco.
author: Alex L.

description:
This little hole in the wall restaurant serves up Filipino food with some Hong Kong style. The first thing that pops out is its very old interior and exterior, but looking past that, the food prices are very cheap. For under 5 dollars, you get a fat plate of food. The food itself is very good! Very authentic! I recommend the Ticino and Hong Kong Pork Chop! 
The staff is very friendly. 
This is the place I use to go to during high school for a lunch and even now, it is still my go to restaurant of choice.
author: Vincent L.

description: Hole in the wall, but I Love this place. Been going here for many years. Best bang for the buck! Also, really tasty.
author: Mel M.

description: Although this is not a filipino owned restaurant they make a good filipino food like tocilog  i have tried here once but will definitely try more of their othe food.
author: Anthony G.

description: This place is a whole in the wall that you would not want to miss. Sure, it's not the cleanest but it's so cheap and good! I tried the Hong Kong style pork chop and it was a huge portion for the price. Every order also comes with tea or coffee. The workers are very friendly. They don't have too many tables so the place can get crowded quick.
author: Lushi Z.

description: Eating here for 20+ years, one of the best foods of all time! I eat there for the freshest bites ever! Get a hot sabow with your meal. I get the Hong Kong style pork chop all the time. Everyone must try it and if you don't like pork then try Hong Kong style chicken. Their tapa is also the best. And also their tocino
author: Ian A.

description:
Hole-in-the-wall does not even begin to describe Superstar Restaurant. From the dingy front sign, the old-school menu board, the damaged ceiling with water stains, the taped-up chairs, and mismatched plates and utensil, Superstar is more like the crack in the wall that always leaks, is discolored and rusting, and large enough for your neighbor to peek through. With that being said, you won't find a cheaper, filling, and more complete meal. At $3-$5 a plate, Superstar stands as one of the best deals in the city.

Superstar serves some variations of Chinese food, but most people come in for the Filipino breakfast dishes. From favorites such as Tosilog, Tapsilog, Longsilog, and Hong Kong Pork chops, Superstar has maintained its clientele with its generous portions and rarely changing prices. And don't be scared to combine certain items, as they are usually really flexible with combinations. Superstar has maintained a good business model, cutting out on most of the extras, to serve their customers a consistent product. Each "silog" comes with eggs, garlic rice, and your choice of pineapple or tomato. When ordering, please mention if you want pineapple as tomato is the default choice.

Superstar closes before most get off work, so plan accordingly during the daytime. Make sure to call in advance as they do get busy, especially during lunchtime. And I recommend ordering for pick-up, especially those of you who prefer or are used to cleaner eating conditions. I have been going here for years, and like the quality of their dishes, some things will never change.
author: Carlo D.

description:
This is literally my childhood.. In a white carton box filled with garlic fried rice, huge chunks of meat, pineapples and eggs LOL.

I grew up with my mom bringing these back to the homefort. She and the owner actually are friends now because she's a regular. Even until now, I find the kitchen filled with these darn breakfast boxes.

This place is literally a hole in the wall. The sign is so small and simple that you probably wouldn't even see it if you were driving. But the workers there are really nice.

Maybe it's the Filipino in me, but goodness I la-la-love silogs, even if it's not made from Filipinos. The people here make a mean silog for an amazingly nice price ( one box is like $3 I think) 

I've tried practically every silog in this joint, but my favorite is their tapsilog and their bangus sisilog. Salty but it keeps you wanting a crapload more. They always ask if you want tomatoes or pineapples with your order and I opt for pineapples, because I have this thing for pairing up salty foods with sweet foods.

Parking is horrible in Excelsior. Either call ahead and pick up or pray to God that there is parking someplace. They only accept cash, so fill up them pockets.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
I spoke too soon, but after trying Superstar after Gateway, I'd say Superstar is the "super"-ior choice lol. Alright, stop throwin' tomatoes. 

In fact, my love for tomatoes is why I rate Superstar better than Gateway. Taste-wise they're pretty similar. I ordered the hotdogsilog at both and they use the same brand. But Superstar offers the choice between a side of pineapple chunks or fresh cut tomatoes unlike Gateway, who only offers the pineapple. 

I believe the prices are slightly cheaper at Superstar, too (maybe by 25 cents). They also offer a hardboiled, salted egg for $0.85 and other Chinese lunch plates, which I don't think Gateway has.

Having a side of tomato and salted egg with my silog plate is how I'm used to eating Filipino breakfast, so that's why Superstar gets my vote, but honestly they're both great, cheap Filipino eats.

It gets an A from me (4/5 stars) for the big portions they give under $5.
author: GG C.

description:
SUPERSTAR! YOU DELICIOUSLY DIRTY DIVE YOU! Superstar is like that 80 year old "seasoned" cast iron pan your grandma has - greasy, grimy and delicious! One step inside and  you wonder what kind of "how low can you go" game of limbo is being played with the health inspector to keep the doors open.

Then you see the menu & the prices, and you're like.. OH.... $3 and something something cents for a giant box of bansilog?? umm...hmm...ok  give me 6 orders with pineapple. Thank you!  

If it's your first time at Superstar, don't be scurred... it's delicious and cheap :)
author: Jay G.

description: This is the best and cheapest Filipino food ever. We had the chicken dish for $4.30 and it was so good. I love it. It is a small restaurant and not too fancy looking. But it is good if you are looking for something cheap and fast.
author: Lien D.

description:
Their HK Porkchops are INSANELY delicious! Ultimate comfort food! And dead cheap...less than $4 for a meal with a fried egg, garlic fried rice, & 2 huge fried porkchops!

Ok so it's not the cleanest place but they do make good food. I guess you get what you pay for. And the family that owns it are very nice to their customers. Very courteous & helpful.

Delicious food at low prices. Can't beat it. Try the Pork Tocino, HK Porkchops, Longanisa....actually anything except the Tapa (not really the best).

Best Filipino breakfast ever!
author: Ralph N.

description:
Regardless of some disturbing things I've heard, I'm still giving this place a 5star because it's not good to just go off what you hear. I've been coming here since I came to America (I was 10, I'm 30 now). My dad took me here and at first I was kind of mad at my dad b/c it doesn't look very pleasant from the outside and inside but I was a kid and I knew better than to be an ungrateful little brat lol 

When I tried their food I definitely was hooked. Their food is cheap. You can spend less than $10 and get full! The only thing is their tocino is kinda oily but it has so much flavor. I love that they serve tuyo (fried sun dried sardines) because no one in my family would dare to cook it at home because it smells bad bad so I'm glad I still get to eat that without having my house smell like strong scent of fish lol I love their jumbo chicken, Hong Kong style pork-chop, sarangani fish (smoked), Bangus fish (fried milkfish marinated in salt, pepper, vinegar and garlic). I just love their food. They may not have chicken sisig but they have so many food I can choose from!
author: Raina J.

description:
This is the best Filipino breakfast restaurant in the Bay Area. 

It is a little gem! Although the facility is small, their food is amazing! It is so affordable. 

My favorite is the baby bangusilog. It comes with garlic rice, egg, and tomato (or pineapple)
author: Samantha N.

description: The stuffs here are nice and polite, and the price is extremely low! The taste of food is ok but considering the economic price it deserves a five star
author: Bo L.

description: The love the food here and you can't beat their prices.  The Hong Kong pork chop is my fave.
author: Gil B.

description:
The fact that this place serves hefty combo plates for a little less than $5 blows my mind. 

It also makes it an anomaly in SF where your average lunch, whether it's a lunch plate, sandwich, or even a salad, is $10 (or more). 

I was skeptical about the quality of the food coming in at first, but after going there twice already I can vouch for it's tastiness. 

I've had the hong-kong style pork chop and fried chicken plates. They give you a lot of meat, flavored rice, a side of either pineapples or tomatoes, and a cup of coffee or tea. 

Sure it's no fine dining establishment (nor would I go there expecting it to be), but for a hole in the wall place that offers a full meal for cheap and quick, Superstar IS the superstar. 

Side note: CASH ONLY
author: Derick N.

description:
Great prices. Big portions. Real home cooking taste. Every plate comes with a cup of hot tea. Garlic fried rice is a plus. Love longanesa and fried egg. Cobo meat is awesome. You really get your bang for your buck. All this under 4 bucks.
Its a great whole in the wall for sure.
Same staff since high school and prices.
author: Hung L.

description:
Pros: Cheap as hell, very tasty, decent selection to choose from, very nice people, convenient location, large quantities

Cons: Extremely packed during lunch, greasy, building not aesthetically pleasing

The first time walking to and into the restaurant, you might be deterred from the old walls and floors. Their taped up menu in the front might look cheap, and their coffee machine old and nasty, but everything is better than it looks! Their building is actually not as bad as it looks and their kitchen is surprisingly clean.

I've been going to this place since high school and it's never disappointed me. What's not to love about this place? Cheap, good, and quick. Perfect for high school and college students that are trying to save money. Hell, it's even great for someone looking for some good Filipino food while in the area!

Superstar has always been my go-to place when I needed some delicious and cheap food. I live in Daly City currently, but I still make the drive up to this place! The location is perfect for people attending City College of San Francisco as well because it's just a 15-20 minute walk or about a 5 minute drive depending on traffic. There is also a Safeway across from the building which makes it even better! Their food always comes with a buttload of garlic fried rice, an egg, and a side of pineapple cubes or tomato slices. I'd recommend trying the Jumbo Fried Chicken (jumbo is not an overstatement) or the Hong Kong style pork chops!

The only thing about this restaurant is that sometimes the food can get a bit greasy. I mean, some of the menu items are fried already, and the egg is probably cooked in a good amount of oil on their skillet. If you're watching your weight, you probably don't want to eat here. The building can also look pretty bad at first sight because the owners have kept the building the same way ever since it was purchased. It's not that bad though, feels a little like going to your grandma's old house.

The last thing is that Superstar can get extremely busy at around noon because everyone is ordering for lunch. There will be people that have 4-5 boxes to-go that have called in beforehand for takeout. They are open until 4:30, so there's plenty of time to wait!

I'd recommend trying this place because it's great, cheap, and in a pretty decent location.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: street parking wasn't bad for me but I can see it being bad. No wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: fast food service. Dirty. Run down ambiance. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

1/3 Stars: food is edible. You get a lot but it's not that good.  Quantity over quality. Very basic food. 

_____

Overall Experience

2/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

Hole in the wall place.
author: Elliott N.

description: Been coming here since I was little, for over 10 years now and this place never disappoints. Cheap, delicious, and always always ALWAYS hits the spot
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
This place is jadeROCKing!

It's been a decade since I've come here, but the food is the same as I once remembered! 

Definately for the broke azz and bang 4 ur buck folks! Good Filipino and Chinese comfort food at rock bottom prices.

Most people go for the Filipino food, but they also serve Chinese rice plates/chow mien for under $5 as well. NOTE: AS IT TURNS OUT THERE IS NO OTHER OPTIONS, JUST THE FILIPINO FAVORITES :)

The staff is friendly and the service is fast.

We got 2 orders of Tilapia, 1 Hong Kong Pork Chop and 1 Fried Chicken for $19.40! Wowzer!
author: Peter L.

description:
If you read any of the reviews then you know that Superstar is cheap, turns out orders fast, has decent food, and that the space comes off a bit dirty / and worn. 

Dishes are in the prices range of $3.25 - $5- , but the bulk are actually less then $4- 

So what do you get? Amazing value with Garlicky Rice , a choice of fruit though many I saw opted for Pineapple over Tomato, a Fried Egg (Mine was not over cooked but also did note have a Runny Yolk), and a choice of Protein with mine being their Flavorful & Crispy Hong Kong Style Pork Chop.

It is busy here during Lunch, but the staff turns out dishes really fast, and the street parking here is not as difficult as one might expect.  

So if your not put off by a restaurant that puts function over style, and wanting some good cheap eats then you can not do much better then Superstar.
author: Joseph A.

description: 4$ Filipino breakfast. You can't beat that! (Unless you go to the Philippines). Hong kong style pork chops and the fried chicken were on point. Generous combo portions and quick service. You can't go wrong here. There was a small piece of plastic wrapper in my fried rice, but that didn't stop me from finishing it. Next time I'll try the beef tapa.
author: Jaime F.

description: Sold out of fish everytime!! the last time I called to hold an order for me I caught an uber all the way there only for them to tell me they misunderstood me and that they just sold the last batch of what I was trying to order. Everyone there is nice, but I'm disappointed, no accommodations or anything. I won't return.
author: Ricky L.

description:
I love this place, it reminds me of home! 

I love everything, but my favorite is the Hongkong style Pork Chop!!! they have big servings and I can't even finish it by myself. You can choose the sideing from pine apple of tomat, I suggest you choose tomato and order an extra side of salted egg!! YUM!!! 

I love dropping by here in the morning for a cheap and great breakfast, the servers are great too.. The place is small, but I don't mid. it's just sad that they close early.
author: Pauline P.

description: Only con about this place that it is cash only. But who can beat a four dollar filling and good breakfast. My favorite is the Hong Kong style pork chop and my second favorite is the fired chicken.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
This review is made from the perspective of a bargain hunter who enjoys hole-in-the-wall type joints.

Odd hours, research them.

Best value in the city, by far. Great for ordering huge takeout orders for your hung over friends.

Actually, this place sucks. Stay away from my hidden gem! Shoo! Shoo!

Also, don't be a turd. Tip the hard-working staff who stand over open flames making their heavenly food. If you don't tip and I see you, I'll call the Cops on you and they will beat you for no reason.
author: Sir J.

description: Are you interested in a heart attack, maybe gout or something heavy?! Maybe you want to treat your girlfriend/boyfriend to a cheap lunch, have no fear Superstar is here!! Get ready for the best poor mans meal. Seriously, Hong Kong style pork chops, itty bitty cat tocino, or maybe some 5 year aged bangus (fish), bomb!! Their garlic rice...phenom... and that greasy egg that has been sitting there for a couple hours and re-heated, to die for!! I could not say enough about this place. They have been here since I was a kid in elementary school and I'm 30 now. They keep their menu small and straight to the point, great breakfast joint!! Don't listen to hate, participate and check it out yourself. This dingy restaurant is located on Mission street across the street from Safeway. They got that Chinese/Pinoy fusion going on. Ask for the rotten tomatoes they pick up next door. Whew! Bomb!!
author: Brian B.

description: Went back for a 3rd time, 2nd time with my boyfriend, and since it wasn't busy at the time, we were served almost immediately.  That's the awesome service and food I remember! This place is now a staple for any visit to SF for me.
author: Sarah S.

description: Good food and affordable. Some portions are a bit small but it will fill you up. Service is great. The place needs work and I think the place can make lots of money if they invest in the interior and cleaning it up with a nice paint. Other than that i was satisfied.
author: Aldrin E.

description:
Cheap, Good and Quick, what else can you ask for.

Perfect Garlic Rice!!!

I strongly recommend the Tocino and the HK style porkchop. I strongly discourage you in getting their beef tapa, it tastes more like boiled beef in my opinon.

Also, I think that all of their meats are store bought (just go to an asian market and they are there) except for their tocino (and the underwhelming tapa), so that might be a plus!!

It just takes some Chinese love to make Filipino silog food, quick and delish! YUM!
author: Jan R.

description: Cheap food, decent taste and big servings. Can't go wrong with that if on a budget and want something quick.
author: Arnaldo S.

description:
Got silogs for brunch - tapsilog, fried bangus, and fried chicken. 

Fried chicken - pretty big piece of chicken, I must say! And was pretty good.

Bangus - also pretty good. They did not have the boneless one, but the boned in one was still pretty good.

Tapsilog- my beef was dried :( felt disappointed due to such. Should've gotten tocilog.. Tselog had such tender and delicious Tapsilog.. even jollibee! Can't wake up on time for jollibee and too lazy to go to tselog.

Rice had a more crunch than I am used  to, but was very good! With the pineapple, it made it sweet, which I enjoyed.

Most of the dishes were around $4 so decently priced, but is by no means a complete and fulfilling meal... would have to eat another .5 to 1 extra plate to get full.
author: Yan L.

description:
Price and portion is 5 stars. 
Taste 4 stars. 
Fast service 4.5 stars.
So 5 stars. If you are sick, too lazy to cook, want something fast & cheap this is the place for you after you bought your medicine from Safeway across the street.
Just be ready to come early, they close for dinner.
author: Icey M.

description:
This place is a SF landmark.
The place is run-down af and looks kind of sketch.
You can get Filipino breakfast meats, HK style pork chop or fried tilapia with garlic fried rice, a fried egg and your choice of pineapple or tomato on the side (to make it healthy) for like $6 ! Definitely try this place next time you got the munchies! Food tastes really bomb but you might not wanna eat here every day!
author: Antonio W.

description: For the price and food, you cannot ask for more. Good helpings and lots of flavor. Always order the Salongs either chicken or hong kong style pork chops and never regret it.
author: Jr D.

description:
Note that this is a HOLE IN THE WALL kind of restaurant. Do not expect anything fancy. Do not expect to be served at your table. But, if you're looking for cheap yummy silogs, you've come to the right place. Expect to pay less than $10 for 2-3 people's meals.

The types of silogs they have: tocilog (tocino), longsilog (longanisa), tapsilog (tapa), tuyosilog (tuyo - fish), bangsilog (bangus), porkchopsilog (porkchop), spamsilog (spam) and baconsilog (yes, bacon). And guess what? They are all $3-4 and come with garlic fried rice, a fried egg and either a tomato or pineapple. 

I usually order food to go here and enjoy my meal at home. I am always tempted to get 2 silogs just for me! It's such a great deal when you're just craving silogs!!!
author: Jess D.

description:
Most silog dishes are like $3. I like the fried hong kong style pork chop for $3.50. All the dishes come with garlic rice and either some raw tomato or pineapple chunks.

This place is a hole in the wall, and cleanliness-wise ultra grimey but honestly those are the places that make the best food.

Frankly, if you grew up in the suburbs and/or never traveled outside to the USA to a second or third world country you probably would think this place looks like an operating health violation.

Hope this place stays open forever!
author: Doug R.

description:
My friend first introduced this place to me when I was a junior in undergrad, as a place where "Chinese people cook Filipino food, with awesome results."

Superstar is where I was first introduced to silogs and garlic fried rice. After my first visit to Superstar, I obsessively studied different garlic fried rice recipes to try to replicate that amazingly unhealthy bite that so filled my stomach with joy that one fateful 2009 morning... with very little success.

So four years later, I visited the store again and decided to get what yelp told me was their most succesful dishes. The place was still a hole in the wall, and still looked dirty as ever, but Garlic Fried Rice with Tocilog + HK Style Fried Pork Chops, all under 10 dollars? You tell me where you can get a heartier breakfast for that amount of money in the city. Your mom's or your grandma's don't count.
author: Scott S.

description: I've been going here since high school. (14 years) Love this place. The people that work here are super nice. If it's your first time I suggest Hong Kong style pork chops. P.S.Don't let the hipsters find out about this place!!! Let's keep the outer mission untouched Please
author: Sasha M.

description: Straight up fire! Food is authentic and tastes like perfection. Not to mention it's dirt cheap.The food comes out super quick too. I got the topsilog with pineapple and coffee which is included. Better than what I eat at home and that's coming from a Filipino herself! I left completely satisfied.
author: Shannon B.

description: I love this place. When my Mother Victoria Orea was alive, we would come here everyday for breakfast. Now I share this place with my Filipina Wife, Catherine Romero. Jeff is excellent. Salamat po. Masarap.
author: Benny R.

description: Went here this morning, called 5 minutes before I got there and it was already finished. Oddly, it was around I believe $14 for 2 dishes. The food isn't as great as gateway kitchen, it seems dirtier, cheaper, and food quality doesn't compare to gateway.
author: Donnah A.

description: My go-to for my Filipino breakfast fix! They have the best longansia and tuyo and they are friendly and fast.
author: R. L.

description: Hk pork chop everytime. Small hole in the wall...looks dirty n dingy but its soo good.
author: Melissa K.

description:
This place is famous for their Filipino Silog's. I usually get the Tapa-silog (beef)

Like what most say, this place looks dirty. Maybe perhaps the locals from the neighbor leave their artistic markings on the walls. But according to their inspection card they are rated 98/100, which is higher than most fine dining restaurants in San Francisco and Palo Alto. I say it feels greasy from the kitchen. And the smell is really strong. Every table has a large bottle of vinegar and some kind of fish/shrimp sauce? The smell is so strong that I get my food as take-out. I'm not sure how people drown their food in vinegar. When I came this place was super-packed with locals. Then again everything on the menu is super cheap. All silog dishes range from $3.25-3.75. Cheaper than McDonalds.

After comparing to Jollibee's, this place is hands down better. It is half the price and less oily/greasy than Jollibee's.
author: Robin L.

description: I've been going to this restaurant for YEARS...possibly my whole life. Definitely a hole-in-the-wall -- the food is cheap, no frills, but the portions are huge and the food is always consistent. I would be so sad if this place ever closed down. It's a true neighborhood staple. Tip: call ahead for pick-up, they'll have it ready in 10 minutes or less.
author: Junelle T.

description: This place always been popular among Filipinos and those familiar. Their logo used to say Superstar Filipino Food now it's just labeled Chinese food. I heard the owner made lots of money over the years and bought lots of houses. All I can say is after milking all of those money from making FILIPINO food, the owner should at least acknowledge and let it be known that what their customers eat is Filipino food. It's just like how China is currently stealing Philippine lands as I type this, Chinese people wil try to profit off of our Filipino food too? These people are shady and greedy! Hongkong style silog really? And the Filipino guy who taught the owner how to cook Filipino food is an idiot and deserve a smack over the head
author: Michael L.

description: Best hole in the wall hands down. I love this place and I hope they continue to stay open with their ultra cheap prices. This is where you come to get your greasy food after a mean hangover.
author: Mick C.

description:
5 stars. $5 can fill you up. Free Coffee & tea.

Superstar is NOT your shining star tourist restaurant. This place has been here since early 80's, maybe late 70's, and the prices are stupid CHEAP. They serve all types of filipino tselog plates, it means everything is served with garlic fried rice, fried egg, and tomatos (you can request pineapple instead). Tapsilog, bangus, whole tilapia, tocino, longonisa, and more. 

This place is really famous for the signature Hong Kong style pork chop. Deep fried pork chop with all its glorified greaazyyyy goodness. I will always make this bad boy a combo, Tapsilog & hong kong pork chop with an extra egg, & sabow on the side (soup broth for melting the greese in my stomach). 

Do not come here expecting a classy atmosphere with waiters to seat and serve. Come here, find a seat, and sit. If the place is full, just stand and wait for a table to open up, people here eat fast, and you should do the same. Once you sit down Jeff or his sister will come take your order, so please do not sit down unless you know what you want. The menu is on the wall behind the register. Order your food, and in less then 5 min, they will run it out to you on old school Chinese plates. Every table has hot sauce, vinegar, salt n pepper, and the sauce dipper dishes are behind the counter, just ask. If this type of stuff scares you, ORDER TO GO!!

Caution: Eating here will make you sleepy! but its hella worth it!! 

I love this place and everyone that loves old school Filipino food love it too, eversince 1980's.
author: Mono L.

description: I cannot believe I got unbelievable clean price here. The food got no problem  and they are friendly to their customers. Definitely I will come again.
author: Kent W.

description: The food has been consistently good since I tried this place out back in 1997 with the same owner. It's the best Tocino I've tried. Only thing is the portion size is small but the price remains inexpensive so no complaints there. If you're super hungry, I suggest you double your order. Reason for the 4 star is because of the decor of this old restaurant. Tocino is a 5 star dish here, hands down!
author: Maggie C.

description: Alright, a rare 5 star review. But it's mainly due to just how cheap this joint is. Every dish is between 3-4 bucks and you get a damn fine portion of perfectly dandy eats. Grab a water cup for your beverage and you're outta there without spending much at all and totally satisfied. What a treat!
author: Chad O.

description:
All I can say is, OMG. So much food for $3! The service was great and the Tapsilog that I ordered was really delicious. :) 
I'm planning to come back more often after visiting today.
author: Amber W.

description: Finally got to come here to try their food the other day. I got the longsilog. I like the Filipino sausages a lot. It's very inexpensive. The garlic rice did seem a bit bland though. I thought the salted egg was way too salty -not recommended. The owner is super friendly and nice.
author: Carmen L.

description: This place has pretty good food for really cheap ($3-$4 for rice, an egg, meat and tomatoes or pineapples). I got the Tosilog with a side of Longsilog and they were both really good. I'm planning on getting that again when I come back.
author: Guorui W.

description:
Holy ish! My boyfriend took me here a couple days ago before the Beyonce concert for the first time and I have to say I was impressed! 

I've ordered the logsilog and the bf ordered the fried chicken. Once we sat down, the food was already done, which I like. Super fast service when I was there during lunch time. 

Each plate was about $4 top, which is super cheap. The quality and quantity was just perfect. The sausages was cooked and marinated perfectly. It wasn't too sweet or too salty. OMG just writing this review makes me hungry and wanting more! You will smell the longanisa in your breath and burps long after eating it...that's how you know it was good!  The garlic fried rice also had enough seasoning, meaning it was not too salty.  The bf also liked his chicken because it wasn't over fried like wingstop wings...

I also liked how we can either get tomatoes or pineapples with the meal. Mhmmm

One thing that stood out was that the restaurant was small, so I don't really suggest coming here with a group of 10 people for a sit in meal. There was about 5-7 tables with a seating of 4 and maybe 2 tables with a seating of 2 people. Most people take take-outs...either way, try this place out! 

Super fast, super tasty, super cheap= happy me!
author: Kim C.

description: Super Star is a Super Star! They are so sweet, food is bomb, and its a cute family owned mom and pop spot. Last of a dying breed
author: Lorain C.

description:
This place is a definite DIVE! 

Having said that, they haven't raised prices ever since I first ate here 4 years ago. Imagine, a gigantic piece of chicken leg, fried egg, garlic rice and chopped tomatoes for less than $4! 

They serve a combination of Filipino and Hongkong rice meals for a bargain, service is pretty fast and definitely one of my #cheapeats love!
author: Gordon O.

description: Yay! I'm a fan. Why? because their food is dirt cheap and the flavors are there. Where else can we buy this kind of food for it's price? I ate there couple times, not the typical 4 star quality ambience but I guess it gets the job done as far as eating your food while its still hot from the kitchen.
author: Eugene A.

description: This place is good if you love to eat breakfast. Hong Kong pork chop is their signature dish but their tosilog and longonisa is amazing!!! Would go here for their breakfast!
author: Nino A.

description: Incredibly cheap eat. For $3.25, I got the Longsilog which comes w/ 2 sausages, an egg, pieces of tomato and garlic rice. Very filling and they make it fast. You really cannot beat it.
author: Julie L.

description: 4 star for the food! Cheap, delicious and it's quick. The restaurant itself is a hole in the wall, literally, but the food is amazing! I recommend the tosilog!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Been coming here ever since I was a kid and I'm GLAD it's never changed, as well as the prices! Hole in the wall, but definitely one of the best hole in the wall spots ever. They used to only have topsilog and longsilog on the menu but I guess they've updated with a lot more silogs! It's a small restaurant so be prepared if you can't find a seat. I usually always order to go and get the tosilog or the porkchop silog. All under $5!! Ran by chinese (I think) but still the BEST silog spot, hands down.

PROS:
-Variety of silogs that are under $5! 
-Usually quick service
-The cashiers are always super friendly
-Mostly to-go
-Can get busy on the weekends
-Their garlic rice is THE BEST garlic rice in silogs ever! Compared to anywhere else this place is number one on my list for silog spots! 
-Good amount of portions! 
-Fried pork chops! A definite must try! SOO GOOD! 
-Also chinese food available, but they're KNOWN for their silogs. 


CONS:
-Closed Sundays! ANND they close a little early. 
-Street Parking, don't forget to pay for the meter!

Whenever I'm in the area I always try to stop by!
author: Veronica A.

description:
in terms of looks, don't expect too much from this hole in the wall place in the mission but it does have some pretty cheap meal combos!

got two HK style fried pork chops, a good portion of garlic rice, a sunny side up egg, choice of tomatoes or pineapples, and two added longanisa for $5

super fatty but pretty good. i wish the longanisas were grilled or cooked a little bit longer though.
author: Katherine C.

description:
This place isn't the nicest looking restaurant, but they did get a 91 on their health score! (That's good, right?) It's a staple in the SF area, so its def here to stay. Hong Kong Style Porkchops is what I order every time. It comes with garlic rice, choice between pineapples or tomatoes, and eggs, and of course the porkchops (or whatever meat/fish entree you order) 

The best thing about this place is that it's DIRT cheap. Two orders of HK porkchops for under $10, haaaaill yeah! 

I wouldn't personally eat there though, take that goodness to go.
author: Kathleene E.

description: Food is good but MAKE SURE YOU COUNT YOUR CHANGE they don't give you back the correct change hence the sign at the counter that says to count your change when receiving because the responsibility is on you AKA we finna rip you off
author: Celeste M.

description:
Not sure if you know this, but if I had to eat one thing for the rest of my life without any health consequences it would be fried pork chop w/ egg and rice, preferably Taiwanese style but today I settled for the HK variety. I don't discriminate much when it comes to fried pork chop. Any style as long as it's done well is fine by me.

A buddy of mine who likes to think of himself as a cheap eats connoisseur turned me on to this place. He initially recommended going to Gateway kitchen but they were closed on mondays. Luckily for us Superstar was open.

Let's start out by saying if you order the HK style fried pork chop for $3.50 you get two slabs of pork, an egg, and some pineapple. The price is unbeatable for the quantity you get. The pork chops themselves are decent, but could have been juicier. The meat was very dry in some parts. They aren't the best slabs of meat, but breaded nicely. The garlic fried rice is simplistic, but hits the spot just right and goes with the pork chop well. 

This joint is a complete hole in the wall. The food came fast and I devoured it just as fast as it was cooked. I'm an incredibly fast eater, which my mom still scolds me for till this day. What she doesn't know won't hurt her. More Cheap eats here I come!
author: Jack C.

description:
One of the very few hidden gems left in San Francisco, more specifically the outer excelsior district. Superstar is a classic food location when you want to get cheap tasty philipino comfort food. 

Located in the outer part of the Mission District, Superstar Resturant is a small, what you would call hole in the wall eatery that serves some of the best Hong Kong porkchops, fried chicken fried chicken, and other tasty Filipino foods. Don't be fooled by the exterior of the location, it does look rundown but that's part of the nostalgic aspect of this location. Once you go inside it's pretty self-explanatory and easy to order anything from the listed menu. Although it's not the healthiest things to eat, all of the dishes are extremely popular to those who know about superstar.

You do have the option to take out or sit in but my best advice would be to take out. That way you won't have to necessarily sit in what is otherwise a drab and dry restaurant with no real Decor. Simply put Superstar let's the food speaks for itself.
author: Donald W.

description:
It's rare to find a restaurant with so much graffiti on its walls (and apparently no desire to clean it up), so consider the décor to be urban gritty. The tables are sticky, the seats are plastic, and the utensils flimsy. It's a noisy place; every seat was taken.

Most meals are under $5. They have silog plates (Filipino breakfast), Chinese rice plates (kung pao, Mongolian beef), won ton soup, and burgers.

* Popsilog ($3.50): popcorn chicken, one fried egg with tomato (or pineapple), garlic fried rice, coffee or tea. The popcorn chicken was probably made at a Tyson factory. Think breaded chicken nuggets. I was expecting the something different. The garlic fried rice wasn't as good or garlicky as Gateway Kitchen's. Yes, the meal was dirt cheap and filling but the frozen chicken didn't impress since reheating it didn't show much skill or cooking effort.

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description:
The joogest place I've ever known since I was conceived.

You get a very generous silog portion (garlic fried rice and an egg) along with your choice of protein and a side of either tomatoes and pineapples. They serve very quickly so once you've order, you settle down to open facebook and your food is ready as you start scrolling.

A gem/hole in the wall, whatever you want to call it, this place is amazing! For years they've been serving the community around them, which includes the high schoolers/city college students in the area. I first came here 4 years ago and I'm surprised they've stayed in business with the same menu and same price! I hope they stick around for many more years!

THANKS SUPERSTAR!
author: Frank C.

description: balboa high school 2008! fuck yea! this shit hella good! I mean it might be dog or cat meat. But don't matta! It herra sarap good! Mmmmmmmmmm Sabaw and extra rice pa more!!!!
author: Chayse M.

description:
You pretty much pay for what you get, but IT IS JOOOOG.

You aren't gonna spend more than $3.50/person, and thats for an egg, tons of garlic rice and your choice of entree. They pretty much cover all the -silogs. 

Things to just keep in mind
- It's a hole in the wall, but those are usually the best places to eat
- Just ignore the mess and the kitchen

And you should do so because the food and price are so worth it!

What I don't get is how all this bomb Filipino food is made and ran by non-filipinos!? They're doing it right,
author: Charmaine P.

description: Ordered the hk fried pork chop and ligands plate. Been coming to this spot for the last 6-7 yrs Cant beat lunch for less than $10!!!
author: Patrick S.

description:
One of those hole in the wall place near my house that I'd never think of going in, until ONE DAY, my boyfriend dragged me in because he had tried it before and he raved about the prices. 

I was in for a surprise, because for the REALLY cheap price, you actually get pretty big portions and pretty good food. I've tried the breaded chicken and longanisa and they're delicious. (Now I'm thinking of that longanisa again... I wonder if I can pay extra for them to add more longanisa on the side)

Would definitely go back
author: Harriet W.

description: This is one of our favorite hole in a wall go to places, for some really good tocino and garlic fried rice! It's inexpensive and delicious. This place has been around for more than 20 years. Never fails!
author: Sahira S.

description: We used to come here often the morning after we went out for a night of drunken debauchery so I can say I have been here a lot in the past lol. You can eat there, but we always got our orders to go. The HK pork chops and any of the silogs are the best. Filipino and Chinese food done right for a good price.
author: Giselle B.

description:
One of the main attractions to the Excelsior community has to be this humble restaurant located across Safeway. This unassuming restaurant will have visitors baffled as to why there's people standing outside of this location a plain looking building. Not much has changed over the years in this restaurant because whatever they have that's working for them hasn't changed either. Huge plates of food for less than five bucks. I'm going to repeat that. Five bucks. 

The choices here are somewhat limited to classic Filipino/Chinese standard like sisig and Hong Kong style pork chops. All dishes are accompanied with some pineapple, a sunny side up egg, and their popular garlic fried rice.

Cleanliness of this place can be an issue at times and for that reason, I usually get my food to go. There are also times where the garlic in the rice gets burnt and almost ruins the entire rice side. 

Overall, make the trip here and try out a plate.
author: George Z.

description: It's a little hole in the wall. I definitely recommend the hong kong style pork chops or the fried chicken. They give decent proportions with fried rice, your choice of meat, with an egg and your choice of either tomatoes or pineapple for a side. If this was open later or even on Sunday's I would definitely be there. Even though they seem to always be busy they serve fairly quickly. If you're looking for good quality at a great price this is definitely the place.
author: Jaztine R.

description: I LOVE this place! Jeff and his Wife are very loving and attentive. I can walk in and they already know my order without me having to say so! I have been eating here for 9 years.The food is wonderful! Very short wait time for your food to be in front of you. Cash only Restaurant, so please come prepared! Large helping of garlic fried rice which is so yummy! I drive from Vallejo to the City only just to eat here all the time! Very well priced, and you get way more food than what you pay for! I love you guys!!!
author: Lin E.

description:
Food = delicious.  Portions are hearty.   I had two plates of tocino (okay, so I actually consumed 1.5 of it, and my friend took the rest home, after he consumed his porkchop plate.)

How do you run out of coffee at 1 p.m. on a Friday?!? lol 

Prices = cheap.  A person could leave here for under $5.00 for lunch/dinner.

Decor = circa 1980s...from floors to ceiling.  Yeah.... reminds me of my childhood in NYC restaurants.  Bwahaha.  Falling apart layers.  That's all I'm sayin'.  

Glad that I finally got to try this SF 'Institution'.   

Overall--I'd be here for a quick bite to eat.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Cheap and tasty are the two perfect words to describe Superstar. Every time I come here I get the same exact thing, the Hong Kong Style Pork Chopsilog...Yummy! 

The restaurant itself is not too nice. It's a bit small and crowded.(that's why I take it to go most of the time :P). Service is not bad, and what can possibly be better than having a delicious lunch for less than 5 bucks?!
author: Yamileth O.

description:
Been coming here for years and its still great! I love their tapa, garlic rice, eggs, pinapple or tomato all for about $4 bucks. This place has saved my life a few times after a horrible hangover when i was younger many many years ago lol 

Place is kinda run down, creepy, hole in wall but plates are awesome
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Good food @ dirt cheap prices. Take the food to-go. Cash only. Cantonese speaking owners, very nice! 

Dat fried rice.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Seriously.... I have no idea how they make money.... For $3-4, you can have a hearty Filipino breakfast that is served in 1 min. Service is on point and fast. People are nice. No complaints.
author: C MH L.

description:
Sooo if you're on a diet or you're super health concious, I'm gonna tell you that this place is not for you. Or if you're a vegetarian, this place is definitely not for you. And if you can't stand being in a restaurant that just don't look clean, don't even think about going through that door. But if none of this applies to you, enjoy and get your moneys worth.  $3-4 gets you a whole plate of garlic fried rice, an egg, and your choice of meat or fish. This is a very popular breakfast plate amongst Filipinos, so don't be surprised when you see my grandparents, my parents, my aunties, or all my cousins there. 

My favorite plate is the Hong Kong Styled Porkchop. It is a must try. I also like the Fried Chicken and the Tilapia. And they don't play around when it comes to portions of the meat or fish. Yes the food is all fried, except for the side of either pineapples or tomatoes, which supports all the saltiness. This place is often packed, but they cook the food so quick and people eat it so fast (because it's freaking good), that you may just end up with a seat.. Please take note it is not open on Sunday, but if you're really craving some of this wonderfulness, Gateway Kitchen, which I believe is under the same ownership, is further down Mission st, can supply you the same satisfaction. And as my sister once joked, maybe this place is good, because dirt is sprinkled on the food. In any case it's freaking delicious.
author: April D.

description:
This place never disappoints!!! Sooooo good!!! I've been going here and Gateway Kitchen since high school. Cheap and good Filipino food.

I always get the toscilog!!
author: Althea D.

description:
I loved their food but then one day my friends and i went to go eat and i need to use the bathroom so one of the waitress told me where it is and went i went to the door the food was on the ground with a tray but it wasnt cover so when i went back to my seat with my friends i didnt feel like eating their food anymore 
But the services are nice 
I feel like they are cheating on the food santantion thats why they bavw a higher rate
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The rating may be somewhat unfair, because the service was okay (for Asian restaurant standards), and the place was just like any other dive-y restaurant.  And the food is cheap.  However, I will never go back. 

Why?  Because the food is BLAND!  If you're looking for Filipino breakfast, there's a significantly better one down the street. But because it's Easter, Filipino restaurants are closed, and we ended up here.  We had the tocilog and the tapsilog.  The tocino tasted okay - but still has a slight pig taste, and the tapa was tender but zero flavour.  The best part was the fried garlic put on top of the rice. But once that garlic is gone, the rice is also bland. Tried putting salt to improve it - still can't extract any flavour. 

Been there, done that, never again.
author: Sarah M.

description: If you are wanting a quick Chinese/Filipino style breakfast this is your hole in the wall! I have been going to superstar for some time now and for me it has been consistent since middle school! I order the Hong Kong style pork chops! The only reason I wouldn't give them a five is because of the decor inside. But then it wouldn't be a hole in the wall right? Seating can be important too :). The main server "Jeff" is such a nice person if not busy always welcomed you to his business. There are other types of breakt plates to enjoy. Explore your tastebuds!
author: Peter G.

description: From the outside this place looks like a liquor store, but when you walk in you'll see that it's a fast food hole-in-the-wall type of place. The food is of great value and extraordinarily cheap. Most of it is fried and that's why it probably tastes so good. Just don't exercise after or go for a run -- it might slow you down. But certainly a great option for a quick fix when you want to save money. For under $5, you can get an order like Fried Chicken or Hong Kong Style Pork Chops that will fill you up pretty good. Their orders also come with garlic fried rice, egg, and your choice of pineapple or tomato. Everything is packed together quite nicely. A working class meal filled with labor and variety. Service is also very efficient and the employees are kind. Just make sure to go before 4:30 pm if you feel the urge.
author: Phillip K.

description:
$3.50 for a fried egg, garlic rice, your choice of Filipino breakfast meat, tomato or pineapple slice and hot tea or coffee?

The place is a hole-in-the-wall, but what a decent meal for the price.  I ordered the breakfast.  It's cash only, but I didn't expect them to take credit.  I ate in.  Don't expect much from the decor; I won't even describe it.

The food came out fast.  The tocino, one of the choices of Filipino breakfast meats, comes from the same part of the pig as bacon.  It was good, but it could have been a little hotter.  The fried egg was more done than I like it (over-easy), but there's no complaining from me.  It all went well with the chunks of raw tomato and garlic rice.

Cheap, quick, tasty and filling.  I'll definitely come back, but it's not for picky ass people.

I came back and tried the Hong Kong style pork chops that people were raving about and is the most popular dish to order.  There was a lot of food for $3.50, but I thought the pork chops lacked flavor.  It's just a deep fried, thinly cut pork chop.  Hot sauce did help the chops, but I probably won't order that again.
author: Jeff H.

description: This place is a hole in the wall joint in SF, so don't expect anything fancy. Their silogs are good. Love the garlic fried rice!
author: Charmaine L.

description: The ultimate value meal and probably the most hole-in-the-wall place you'll find in the city. From the outside it looks super shady and run down, and the inside isn't going to change your opinion of that, but once you order a $4 box of food you'll change your mind. I like the big chicken leg with rice here, but they have lots of other combos. The food is all really simple so it comes out really quickly.
author: Allen C.

description:
Same as Gateway Kitchen???

CHEAP GREASY FILIPINO FOOD YAYYY! Bigger menu than Gateway but same dirt cheap prices

Call in your order so you don't have to wait for your food
author: Harry T.

description:
Pros - Jumbo fried chicken and hong kong style pork chops. Cheap. 

Cons - cash only. hole in the whole clean. Closes at 6PM and on Sundays.

I use to come here when i was a little child. After school i would not eat and spend my lunch money here for a huge meal. This place is dirt cheap, so cheap i dont know how they keep the price so low. For close to $3 you can get a huge mutated size chicken (legs and thigh) with garlic rice and an egg. The Chicken is cooked asian style and pan fried. The skin is super crunchy and delicious. The hong kong style pork chops are really good too. They give you 2 pieces, but a lot of it is bone. 

A lot of filipinos come here cause they make filipino dishes here but its chinese owned. I always call ahead and take it to go. The place is kinda dirty and you actually get bigger portions when you get it to go. 

I really like going to this place! I dont come here often anymore because it is super un healthy. But i recommend it anyone who likes cheap food.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Pros:
1) Tasty Soul Foods
2) Cheap
3) Convenient in the city 
4) Big portions of food

Cons:
1) Place is somewhat dirty
2) Fatty Junk Foods :(

Tips: 
1) Can park in residential area free
2) Share your plate of food :)
3) Call to order ahead & pick up to go
author: Juila L.

description: Before GATEWAY opened in DC i used to come here first. The food was alright. Gateway tastes better. AND i think it is the same owner for BOTH GATEWAY & SUPERSTAR. Not the greatest location, so i recommend take out.
author: Rose P.

description: LOVE this place!!! such good food for the low too! HIGHLY recommend.
author: Samantha H.

description:
A good place to get Cheap Filipino Breakfast! First time my friend took me there we had the PorkChopSilog. The meal itself was enough to feed two people. Just had to order a side of garlic fried rice and egg. The whole meal for two including two sodas was probably close to or under $10. This had to be at least 5-10 years ago. prices may have gone up. At that time, Tapsilog (Marinated beef, garlic fried rice & egg) was $3-$4.
