The place is definitely small, and looks kind of dirty, but it's worth it for a meal under 5 bucks.  And the portions are huge.  You definitely get your money's worth
author: Kristel D.

description:
Wow, a meal for less than $3!!! I love how it is so cheap here, and i always get full. I only get the longsilog here. So, whenever I am craving filipino food, I come here since it is near my house. 

The only bad part is, the restaurant looks quite dirty, and you can see the kitchen when you order the food. And I always try not to look too hard to prevent myself from finding anything I find disapproving. I always get the food to good. 

Plenty of street parking outside.
author: Willa L.

description:
5 stars for affordability, 3 stars for food quality.

I've been going to this place for years and they were always there when you had a mean appetite and only had a couple dollars to your name. For the price, I can't really complain, but if I had to point a couple things out then it would be the way they made their tocino...Instead of it being served in their normal form of meat chunks and strips, it is broken down into mini niblets which is unsatisfactory in my book. The rice is also fried in bulk which is a half-ass attempt to cooking garlic fried rice. Being such a small Hole-In-The-Wall family owned restaurant, I understand that they have to whip those plates out in record time in order to satisfy the masses, so i'll give them points for that. 

But once again, I cannot complain for the amount of food I am given with the price I pay. I must say that they serve the meanest Hong Kong Style Pork Chops and Bangus. Turn those two choices into a combination rice plate and you have yourself a feast!

One more thing I must mention is that they are closed on Sundays out of all days! They are literally missing out on the potential cashflow they could be receiving due to the early morning church-go'ers and  lazy sunday post-party animals looking for something quick and cheap to eat. 

I love this place to death and will continue to eat here but these are just a few suggestions for a great place to make it an even better place!
author: Duane R.

description: Sorry to say this, but small, questionable cleanliness food joints are the best places to eat! =) Ate here for the first time a over a month ago with my sister. We had the silogs (under $3 bucks). She had the bangsilog, while I had the longsilog. They ran out of tomatoes, so they gave us pineapple instead (we wondered why didn't they just buy tomatoes next door at the produce market ?). Loved their garlic fried rice and they didn't skimp!!  As we were leaving, we noticed that a few of the lunch crowd had the huge fried pork chop. Hmmm....might have to come back to try that. Damn, I'm going to have to increase my daily workouts this Summer =).
author: Neni E.

description:
I have first say that this is probably the only place in SF that you'll feed two big eaters for under $6, ALTOGETHER. That being said, Yelp should have a new price range called UBER CHEAP (less than $5/person)

So, my cheap-ass Asian side LOVES that.

Authenticity-wise, didn't really impress my Filipino boyfriend.  He liked their Spamsilog (but c'mon I have yet to meet a Filipino who DOESN'T like spam) and their garlic fried rice.  However, the longanisa left him wanting, so much that he didn't eat the second longanisa link (and he RARELY leaves uneaten food on his plate)  I was halfway tempted to eat it for him since I hate wasting food myself, but my vegetarian conscience wouldn't let me.

So speaking of which, once I told the guy behind the counter that I was vegetarian, he immediately gave me BOTH pineapples and tomatoes w/ my garlic fried rice... who knew such simple food could make me so happy?

To echo previous reviewers, this place definitely does not get famous off its ambience.  Definitely small and cramped, sticky tile floors, but hey overall not horribly dirty.  Having grown up eating at hole-in-the-wall's all over SF, Hong Kong and Hawaii, I'm totally ok with it... but it may not be suitable for the faint-hearted.

One more thing... not sure if this bothers some hardcore Filipino diners, but the owners and cooks of Super Star are NOT Filipino.  They are a Chinese family who speaks Tagalog and Cantonese (so my boyfriend and I could both pick up bits and pieces of their kitchen conversations).  However, that doesn't seem to bother many of the Filipino locals in the area... many of them seem to be regulars.

So if you're hungry and broke, this be your place.
author: Catherine C.

description:
This place is really hole in the wall.  Very little seating area.  And the cashier area was packed last time I was there.  

I never had Filipino food before Super Star, so I let the bf order.  The HK style pork chop was DELICIOUS!  and they did it RIGHT!  CRRRUNNNCHYY and juicy inside.

The bf ordered two -silog HIS way, with additional Filipino sausages, spam, extra whatever the heck he can think of, with two coconut juice.  Thanks for the coconut juice to CLEANNSEE the heaviness, so I can eat more.

Needless to say, we didn't finish the two -silogs, and had that for dinner as well.  It was ALL worth it.

To sum up my Super Star experience:  SUPER satisfying, cheap, good eat.  But i'll be Super Star OUT for the next few days.
author: Gigi T.

description: I've been eating here since high school. Thats 1 star. And another star for the prices. But other than that, its straight up grease!!! The rice you're eating is like weeks old. They just let it sit there  and get brown before the cook back for your order. The place looks like shit. I love the sign on the wall thats warns that there are carcinogenic ingredients in the food. But other than that,   Eat here if you like bad cholesterol and shit food!!!!
author: Mar M.

description: When on a tight budget, and cursed with a huge appetite, superstar is my SUPERSTAR.
author: Sinoeun M.

description:
The best value I know of. You can get made to order Filipino-style breakfast for under $4.00. It's pretty much garlic fried rice, one egg, either tomatoes or pineapple, plus your choice of "meat" including:

Fried fish (bangus or tilapia), longanisa, bacon, spam, fried chicken, popcorn chicken, or the highly popular Hong-Kong style pork chop.

It's definitely not the most pleasant looking place, but who can complain with the price?
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
Whenever I am on a budget, Superstar never goes wrong. You get a whole meal, complete with garlic rice and tomato/pineapple for under $4. Superstar is always a win win. Not to mention, the man who works the cashier is always energetic.

I love the tapsilog with a side of Hong Kong style porkchop. Although the place is a hole in the wall, I would recommend you order the food to-go. This is a great spot for college students who are on a budget.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Hmm what can i say about this place???? When i was a broke middle school student cutting class and hungry. Where would we go..... SUPER STAR... another reason why i love Filipinos.. "Cheap Breakfast"...  you cant beat 2.99 for meat, pile of rice, egg, pineapple and coffee.

The only bad thing which has nothing to do with this restaurant but with Filipino food in general is that count on tasting your food for the rest of the day.
author: Alfredo N.

description:
This place is seriously a hole in the wall to get great, cheap Filipino breakfast! You can't get anything these days for $3 bucks! I live in the suburb, and my bf's sister introduced us to this place! It's cheap but I love it! Especially the fried garlic rice, with tocino, and eggs and top it off with tomatoes!!! 

I'll take out one star, like the other reviewer, the rice is kind of hard sometimes. I prefer Gateway's Kitchen's rice....its much softer!
author: Lissie B.

description:
Loved this place during my stay in SF. Wake up, call up the friends, and all we need to say is one word. "Superstar" :)

Cheap food and perfect for the mornings, it cant get any better than this.
author: Andy Y.

description: outside had me a lil sketch, but its good, n wont dent your pockets at all, youll prob spend more on the meter outside.
author: Pete F.

description: For the price!? WHO CAN REFUSE!? I was so hesitant when my friend pulled up to this hole in the wall and said, "here we are!" I had to stay in the car while he picked up our take out.. I wasn't stepping in there! However when I got home.. I tore that food up! Super good for the price. Now it's not to die for... but for the price. I can deal!
author: Deanna G.

description:
$2.95 for some garlic rice with an egg on top, 2 pieces of hong kong style pork chop, and some side of vegetable, or fruit?  You cant beat that.  

Cheap food if you feeling for some greasy heart clogger.

Restaurant is pretty much a hole in the wall but its good.  They got a score of 98/100 for health inspections.  So.. i guess you cant judge a book by its cover.

Beware: Dont use the bathrom.
author: Mabel C.

description: This is definitely one of them hole-in-the-wall places you DEFINITELY need to check out!  Quick services, portion size is HUGE and the prices cannot be beat!  I believe everything is under $4.  My favorite is the Tocino, very tender!  Not much seating tho.
author: Janet P.

description:
If I had visited Super Star for the first time recently, I would probably give superstar 3 stars, but every time I come here I get this sense of nostalgia which gives this restaurant an extra star. I've been eating their longsilogs since my freshman year of high school. There is just something about Super Star that keeps me coming back! I think I know what it is--- Cheap, friendly, fast, and there is actually some good food on their menu. I would recommend this place to all the starving college students out there paying your tuition because you can get an entree of your choice (ie. longanisa, tocino, hong kong style porkchop), garlic fried rice, choice of tomatoes or pineapples, fried egg, and a drink for under 5 bucks! Now that sounds like a well balanced meal! 

Recommendations: 
Longsilog
Tocinolog 
Hong Kong Style Pork Chops
Jumbo Fried Chicken
author: Lisa T.

description:
Ok, I'm Filipino and love Filipino food for all its greasy goodness. 

This dingy little hole in the wall joint isnt the most visually appealing place on Earth. Don't be afraid to park at Safeway to walk across the street just in time before the closing time at 4 or 6 or whatever early ass time they close.

The food here is f'n delicious, its dirty cheap, and will probably clog your arteries, but goddamnit I love it!!
author: Eric A.

description:
IMPRESSION:

I tried to run away from this place when my significant other brought me here one day. Were it not for the tight grip on my wrist and lecture on being snobby, I would have ran back to the car.

 Why? Because I couldn't believe a place that dirty was actually a restaurant. Dingy, dirty, depressing. BUT amazingly THE FOOD WAS GOOD.

However like someone said, were I to look in the kitchen... it might be another story. I am surprised they passed the health inspection. 

FOOD:

The garlic fried rice is a bit heavy for my taste but it suits most people fine. It would be better to get steamed rice if you're ordering a fried or greasy meat component. I ordered the fried chicken, and it was moist and flavorful inside, not dry like I expected. 

The sunnyside egg and tomato are nice sides that accompany every dish. I liked their Longaniza, philippinio sausage, better than the chicken. I never tried it before and it was savory and sweet at the same time. The flavor was very intense so again, steam rice might be a better option. 


COST:

It is dirt cheap, 3-4$ dollar for a meal. I wouldn't take someone on a first date here though. The food might be decent, but you might be labeled a cheap ass and again the "decor" will scare away your date. Would I come here again? I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. If I was in the neighborhood, I will order to go. Maybe. It is highly dubious that I will eat inside again.
author: Zelda N.

description: I grew up eating here and it never gets old. The most ghetto restaurant you will ever see but they make up for that with their food. If you are ever hungry and on a budget craving that filipino and chinese food then this is the place to go!
author: Karen N.

description:
This place is the epitomy of hole-in-the-wall.  Although they've got a tiny seating area, people do not stop coming in to place orders.  The line is usually out the door on weekends.  I'm only assuming that the store was never remodeled, because the walls are completely engraved by different people, there is an old school menu nailed to the wall-- that no one pays attention to and the actual menu is taped up.  Totally ecclectic.

Pro's: SUPER cheap.  Finally, a cheap place that serves good filipino food. Plates are no more than $4.00 each.  The Fried Tilapia and Hong Kong style pork chop is pretty tasty. They also provide garlic fried rice, one fried egg and a choice of tomatoes or pinapples with every order. They fill you up. 

Con's: Don't expect anything fancy.  Crowded- consider calling order in first.
author: Anne K.

description:
ummm- restaurant?  no

7 slices of bacon, 2 scoops of rice, 1 fried egg and sliced tomato for $2.99?

yeah.

done.
author: Katie H.

description:
If someone asked me to define 'hole in the wall', I would definitely  take them here. I've frequented this place for quite some time now. The prices have not changed, the staff has not changed, and the menu has even been expanding over the years lol! 

As a broke college student, this is definitely my go to spot when I'm hungry and on a budget.  I've taken a few friends here and all were in disbelief when we ordered two full course meals for under $8. Pork Chop HK style & Jumbo Friend Chicken have got to be the best deal. I can order either the two for lunch and still have half left over for dinner...and each cost about $3.50! 

Parking is very limited and so is the seating inside. I would recommend taking the food to go but I sometimes eat in to prevent my car smelling like vinegar lol. 

The only negative thing I could say about Superstar would be that their hours are very limited. For years I've hoped that they would convert to a 24 hour spot. Those after-club night dinners, I pay twice the price for half the food over at Ling Nam in Daly City and always eat it bitterly when I think of Superstar.
author: True C.

description: Cheap, dirty, delicious. Just the way I like it ;) Superstar will always have a place in my heart.
author: Shirley D.

description: so greasy...but so cheap and so GOOD! very cheap food for a great price. i got the fried pork chop with AMAZING garlic rice, an egg, and 2 filipino sausages! the sausages are the typical sweet goodness you would get from any restaurant. the pork chops honestly arent the best tasting. they are typical deep fried pork chop. i guess im giving 5 stars more for quantity and a super cheap price. this place will not hurt your wallet at all. dungy ambience..get your food to go.
author: Jason W.

description:
uhhhhh $3 for breakfast! 

longanisa. two sausages. one egg. garlic fried rice. u cannot go wrong! 

the restaurant itself is small, not much seating room, and its really not that clean and the bathroom is kind of gross. =/ but the food is great!
author: Lisa N.

description: Low price for a huge portion of good tasting food. Somewhat busy most of the time. Just park in Safeway for free and jaywalk across the street and enjoy your meal. All of the employees there are very nice, including the janitor who keeps this place pretty clean even if it looks old. Kudos to her.
author: Peter K.

description:
dizzzzzzzam! place is old and run down but, who cares! 
ALWAYS hella people in here, and always a line during lunch time.

the usual orders: spamsilog, tocino,  HK style pork chop, tapsilog

oh yeah, gateway kitchen near top of the hill on mission = SAME ONE! they're owned by wife and husband, and they both work at either one!
author: Kenny L.

description: OMG! this place is like HEAVEN! I love their filipino food and the super SUPER cheap prices! I got my boyfriend hooked on this so we go when we can!
author: Mariane T.

description: great food for price .. 3.50$ feeds you well .. no where else in sf is this cheap .. I like the fried chicken and pop corn chicken !!
author: Micah W.

description: if you are low in cash but very hungry this palce is very affordable for a good meal.  I have been going to this place for several years now.  and everytime i go to stuff my face if its take out, dine in or to feed all my kids i have no complaints.
author: Charlotte G.

description: Went here for the first time, could not believe the prices and how quickly they prepare the food. you really can't go wrong with a menu with everything around 3$. It will be packed during lunch time so either take-out or if you wish to dine-in come off hours. You must visit this place at least once if you're in the area
author: Home S.

description: I live in the East Bay, so whenever I am in SF and crave cheap filipino food I come here. The place is small so I usually order and take it to go. The service is quick and the staff is very friendly. The food is yummy and incredibly cheap. They have everything like garlic fried rice, egg...choice of meat like longanisa, tocino, tapa, bangus, hong kong style pork chop...Good stuff!!
author: Celly R.

description:
I've been going to superstar restaurant since I came to this country in 1986. The food is very good and cheap. IT is not the cleanest restaurant but i'm not there for that. I went there when I took the bus and walked, i went there when I got my used Civic, I went there for my graduation lunch. 

And today I still go there with my 2007 Bentley GT Continental, parked right in front of the dirtiest payphone in the City, just to get my $3.00 Tapsilog!  

Sometimes it does not make sense to drive to SF from the East Bay and spend $15 on gas to get $3.00 Tapsilog, but then again it is Superstar, they are the best.

dont forget to say hi to Jeff, "my friend"!!!
author: Alexander M.

description: Pretty good tapa... and the price is right! Garlic rice is yums! This is the spot when on Mission.
author: Janelle A.

description: As good as it gets you a  homemade authentic Filipino breakfast, from your typical hole-in-the-wall spot. My favorite: Tocino (marinated pork), garlic fried rice, eggs, and tomatoes all for $1.99 or $2.99, I think... Wouldn't sit and eat here though as there's only metered parking outside/double parking available.
author: Art G.

description: This place Is really good the people are nice and it's really cheap If you go here I recommend the hong kong style pork chop and the jumbo fried chicken even if you get both it would only cost you around  8-11 dollers
author: Gee L.

description: Oh MAN..childhood memories. The crazy thing is that its still dirt cheap. Try the boneless bangus..its soo good. And that fried rice..yes it'll give you garlicky breath but I'll take it. Don't eat here just take it to go..This is the kinda place where you can act like a big shot and treat all your friends for breakfast. I'm telling you, feed a group of 5 for $12..now thats outrageous. Oh yea, I don't care how greasy it is..its SUPERSTAR...
author: Amanda G.

description: so if there was a half dollar sign, i would choose that cause this place gives major bangs for bucks! i got the fried pork chop which comes with 2 huge deep fried pork chops, garlic rice, pineapple, and i added 2 longanisas for about 2 bucks. 5.50! kiddin me?! yeah the food is super oily, but it's a sinful indulgence once in a healthy man's life. the place is pretty run down, and its not even close to nice..so i suggest the food to go.
author: Jason W.

description: Their prices are unbelievable! Definitely good enough for me to drive back when I'm in the area. I liked there tocino, deep fried pork, rice, and eggs.  I had to buy some to go for dinner. Its a small "mom and pop" shop. I do recommend it.
author: Lynn J.

description: I don't know what I would do without this place. Going to school and being a baller on budget made it easy for my friends and I to love this place. Just don't mind the cosmetics of it, the food is dirt cheap ($3) and the owners are just humble people. It is a lifesaver. I recommend the Hong Kong style pork chop with tomatoes, garlic fried rice and egg over easy. Thanks Superstar!
author: Rhea V.

description: Yummy no? Now try going to the bathroom and spotting all the pre-cooked white rice sitting in plastic bins around the the back. GROSS!
author: Jason S.

description:
One of the reasons I MISS SF!!! I grew up eating this!lmao... Superstar was the Perfect Hole in the Wall Fil-Chinese place. They are quick and just yummy! 

My McAteer days and City College days brings back memories, this was the spot! Ate with friends here during lunch breaks and it reminds you of the "home cooked breakfast" 

Love the "Bansilog & Tosilog" sometimes the "Hong Kong style porkchops"...drool! haha.. So not sexy! But omg! Love this place and I can't believe they are still around, I mean, I believe it! They are so affordable and food here are delicious.
author: Fannie R.

description:
see we do have GOOD EATS in the excelsior!  =)

i love superstar.  BEST silogs EVER and not just because its under $4!!  haha.  but seriously for the amount of food you get, i feel like i'm ripping THEM off.  hehe im not complaining though!  i always go for the hong kong style porkchop-silog!  massive amounts of tasty garlic rice, an over easy egg, tomatoes, with 2 huge porkchops.  YUMMMMM.  you definitely get MORE for your money here.

for those that have never been though, BEWARE cause its a little bit on the grimey side.  but DONT worry, its REALLY good.  just always order to go like i do!  they make your food in like 5 min!
author: Francia T.

description: we been eating here for over 10+ years since high school days... just love the price and the portion but the last time i went there was a few month ago... the size got smaller and lesser, i won't blame it... still cheap for the price and the amount, i don't get why people complaint and leave bad feedback when you paid less then $4 for the meal... some are just under $3... this place get packed quick with people and line, i recommend you calling them ahead.... order thru the phone then pick it up in 15 minutes, way faster!
author: JessePanda C.

description:
been going there for years.  cheap, fast, good filipino food.  

for those who don't know, they serve -silogs...a -silog is basically a filipino breakfast plate that includes a meat, sinangag (garlic fried rice), an egg, and sliced tomatoes.  you can get:

tocsilogs - tocino (cured meat)
bansilogs - bangus (fried fish)
tapsilogs - tapa (beef)
spamsilogs - spam
hotdogsilogs - hot dog
or my favorite
hong kong style pork chop silog

i believe their $2.75 for a silog, and they have nice portions
the hong kong style pork chop silog is $3.95

i hardly ever dine in as the place is small and even though it seems kinda dirty, i saw that they got a 100 on the green "sanitary card", which means they're apparently, clean!

don't expect fine or even nice dining here.  expect good old fashioned, probably unhealthy, cheap filipino food cooked by chinese cooks! mmmmmmmmmm!!
author: Ray R.

description: one of my all time favorite places, I've been going here since I was about ten, nothing much has changed inside, except for the price inflation, but even with the increase its affordable. the standard to order is the Tocino, but I do like the Pork Chop and the Bangus as well. There is some variety.
author: Karl B.

description: best place for breakfast when you're on an EDD budget. $3&change will get you deep-fried HK pork chops, garlic rice & your choice of tomatoes or pineapple. excellent cure for hangovers btw. portions are huge so one order is good for 2 meals. this hole in the wall is not the cleanest but the ridiculously inexpensive menu makes up for it.
author: Grace V.

description: I usually make Filipino breakfasts on my own and I know how easy it is to make these dishes so it's nice to finally find a place that has low prices on such easy dishes to make.  The setting isn't really nice but the service and food is pretty good for the price you pay.  It's a great place to get full off of what feels like home cooked food.
author: Don A.

description: $3 HK style pork chop all the way! BUT... well, the place is dirty! haha
author: Bernice N.

description: if you want cheap fiilipino food under 4 dollars eat here!!!!! hole in a wall place but it is soo good. Since grandma or parents aren't here to cook me longanisa, tocino with garlic fried rice come here!! it is MASARAP! lmao.
author: Iba N.

description: Their food is good, especially the Hong Kong style porkchops. I would never want to eat there 'cause the place looks disgusting but take-out is always great! And you get full with just a few dollars. ;)
author: Jessica R.

description: this place.... there is no place like this neighborhood gem. If you can scrape 3.75 in change or pull it out of your sock literally like some of the customers, then your set to get a big heavy garlicky, greasy orgy of deep fried goodness, unless you want to play it filipino after church breakfast and get the tocino. But i would recommend the hong kong style pork chop because you get the most food, and chances are if you are coming here you are broke and hungry. Oh and if you are and advocate of writing on stuff that isnt yours (not like me ahem ahem) you are also in for a treat in their bathroom.... SMELL YA LATER
author: alex l.

description: Great place to pick up a "Filipino" breakfast for about $3.  You get your choice of meat ... longansia, tapa, tocino, bangus, and something else maybe??  All are served with eggs over easy, and garlic fried rice.  Good cure for a hangover.  As usual, no parking.
author: Michael M.

description: I know GHETTO filipino food!!!!  BAM!  For the price.... this place works...  I won't reccomend this place to white people, hipsters, foo foo Asians, people on a diet, my wife...  I do crave this place from time time....  I do see hard working clue collar crowd sometimes coming in after a hard morning working....  ITS GRUB!
author: Demanding T.

description: Whether you opt for the Filipino breakfast, or the HK style pork chops, this place is unbeatable.  Everything is complimented with an order of garlic fried rice and a side of tomatoes or pineapples.  It's really hard to beat this place considering the value, and consistency everytime I come here.  The fried chicken never fails.  The place is dirty, the tables are tattooed with grease spots, and I wouldn't hesistate for a second about coming here.  That in itself should say a lot!
author: Alan N.

description: Great Cheap Eats!!.. but definitely not the spot for a first date. I've been eating at this spot since '93 or so and I think it's a wonderful blue collar meal. If you're not a total snob this is a awesome place for a quick inexpensive lunch or to-go plate. Last time I went I had the Tosilog with a side of bacon for less than $5 (meatanarian's special) .. 5 stars for sentimental reasons and bang for the buck... the place could definitely benefit from renovation though.
author: Ruel D.

description: This place has fed me many times.  For probably three years straight I would eat here at least once a week.  My 1985 Ford LTD station wagon smelled of garlic fried rice and gristle.  I dig the way these guys do business and it felt cool to go grab a fried porkchop from a dirty hole-in-the-wall then walk over to the market and grab some scratchers.  It was as if I had aged 20 years ahead of schedule.  Retirement looked good.  Alas, Superstar caught up with me so I allow myself to make it there at least once a year.  This place holds great value and fond memories.
author: Casey C.

description: This place brings me back so many memories when I was growing up in the city. They kept the same hand painted menu stand since I was 6 years old.  I remember when it was $0.99 for Filipino Breakfast. Superstar is the only place in the world where you can have tocino, garlic rice and 1 EEG on your plate.
author: Chris M.

description:
the good: the longsilog is $2.30. where the hell else are you to buy longsilog for $2.30? nowhere. IT'S PRETTY DAMN GOOD AND HITS THE SPOT TOO, WHO CAN COMPLAIN? the parking isn't that bad for being on mission. 

the bad: it's a hole in the wall a place, which doesn't bother me, but if you're going to bring people there you better give them a heads up. getting a table is pretty hard sometimes, especially if you go in the morning. they have weird days where their closed, so you should call first.
author: T V.

description: Recession style prices for great food, it has always and consistently throughout the years been the place to eat for a $3-$4 budget.  Tocino, Longsilog, Fried Chicken... the place to be.
author: Antonio C.

description:
$3 dollar meals, need i say more.  it might not be fine dining and the restaurant not so sanitary but the food gets the job done.  i usually order two different dishes and devour them. i'm glad theres a place for broke people like me. lol. i use to come here all the time when i was going to balboa high, a block away.

for the price i give this a 4.5 star but for the quality of food i'd give it a 3 star.
author: Cedric F.

description: C'mon.... $2.75 for toscino (sweet pork), garlic rice, fried egg, and tomatoes! That's priced from the early 90s! The food is gooood and the portions are generous. My friend always gets either the sausage or HK style pork chop. Maybe cause the owners are Chinese and I'm Chinese, so there's a twist to the Filipino food that hits home for me. Or, it can just be bomb Filipino breakfast! Either way, my Chinese ass loves this place!
author: Freckles H.

description: This place and food totally make me sick! I hate the skinny guy standing behind the counter!
author: Kin M.

description: WHATSUP JEFF, CAN I GET 1 TAPA & 1 TOCINO! ....I love this place. i lived in a shitty inlaw up the street and went here every morning for breakfast, back when it was $1.95 (or $2.17) i love it and i'll go back everytime. ....by the way, is his name really jeff??
author: MICK E.

description: There is only one place to go for Filipino breakfast, and this is the place. The thing that really makes this place great is that people of all nationalities love this place. And how can you blame them, you get quality food for under $5. That's right, the average price for a meal here is $3-$4. You definitely can't go wrong here.
author: Rommel N.

description: This place is ghetto!!!  But I LOVE IT!! Hole in wall place on the mission. I love their hong kong style porchops served with garlic fried rice and a tomato or pineapple for under 5 bucks!!!  I got introduced to this place by my coworker who grew up eating this food during high school lunch breaks. That was 5 years ago when he brought me here and at times I get the superstar craving. Last week, my coworker and I were talking on IM at work and he asks me, you know what Im craving for? We both responded: SUPERSTAR!!! LOL
author: Mark J.

description:
Less than 3 bucks for longsilog?
A 2 minute wait for my food?
Perfectly runny egg-yolk to spill over my garlic fried rice?
Food was still delicious an hour later without being microwaved?

Definitely worth a trip to the outer mission. Where else can you find a deal that good these days?
author: Kirstie R.

description: Great food for cheap.  Park at the Safeway across the street, get groceries, then get orders of hong kong style pork chops or tocino for take out.  The place could use some cleaning.
author: My Two Cents E.

description: Where can you get lunch for $2.50 nowadays? Here at this hole in the wall!  I always order the longsilog.  You get 2 longanisa sausages, an egg, garlic fried rice and your choice of pineapples or tomatoes for only $2.50!!  Other favorites for less than a dollar more includes the Hong Kong Styled Pork Chops and the Jumbo Fried Chicken.  They weren't lying when they say Jumbo... That piece of chicken is ginormous!  Parking is always available across the street in the safeway parking lot, so no driving hour in circles looking for parking. Want great, cheap food with great quantities? This is the place!  It may not be the cleanest place, but for the price, I cant complain.
author: Damon J.

description: I come here for the HK style pork chop.  They did a great job infusing chinese dish in a Filipino breakfast. Who would've thought a cantonese owner would make Filipino breakfasts? The place is not recommended for those expecting a super clean restaurant. C'mon now, it's a hole-in-the-wall joint.  Take it to go.  Otherwise, most of their si-logs(fried rice and egg dishes) are under $5 compared to other places that serve them for over $6. I tried most of their si-logs and all I can say is that  the HK style pork chop and the Filipino sausage (longganisa) si-logs are the best so far.
author: JB L.

description: This place has been around forever and their prices have changed only recently and with that only a couple of cents.  Personally, I don't know how they keep themselves open with such low prices.  They give rather big portions.  Upon entering, you look around and start to realize that this is the type of hole in the wall place where you would rather not eat, but rather order to go.  Every time I go there, I get this feeling where it crosses my mind to check the validity of it's sanitary conditions, yet scared out of my mind just to know what I could possibly find out that would tarnish me eating there forever.  I would recommend this place if you're in the area, you're hungry, and you happen to have extra change that you want to spend.
author: Christine D.

description: It's pretty embarrassing to be Filipino, living in the Excelsior and never having eaten here until recently. It's bad enough I don't know how to cha-cha or shop at Serramonte but to have only discovered this place a few weeks ago is completely unforgivable. Like others have said, the breakfasts are BOMB. $3 tocsilog for the win! It's definitely run-down and ghetto but look where it is. But hey, I'd rather eat here than at Poleng... The meals are probably a week's worth of calories but I don't care! Indulging once a month never hurt anyone.
author: Janelle B.

description: I used to come out here back in tha day when the Longsilogs were $1.90 for the complete meal, and David was still the guy who always took my order.  I dont it's been over 10 years now and I just went there for lunch today and the Longsilog cost $2.50 again for the complete meal exactly like they always made it.  My all time favorite is the "Sarangani" Boneless Bangus extra Garlic.  The service is fast, the food is good, the cost is very very affordable.  Masarap & mura. What else could you ever ask for when hungry.  You can treat 6 friends for Longsilog lunch for under $20 bucks.  And they will be satisfied with a complete meal.  Where else in the city could you do that. "NO WHERE".  SO I am a customer for life.  The place seats about 20 people and not real fancy, just good food at a very good price.  No, don't take your first dates here.
author: gordon g.

description: Super Star Restaurant is a cheap and nasty place to eat. I ate there about a month ago and I don't think I will be eating there again. First off, The cleanliness of that restaurant is disgusting. Second, The food there is horrible, after eating the tocino that looks barely cooked, I feel dirty and gross for eating it. I'm sorry but this restaurant is not for me.
author: Eric C.

description:
$3 for spamsilog.
awesome garlic rice, sided with pineapples, egg, and, of course, 2 pieces of spam.

it was delicious. the perfect  remedy for comfort food when coming home to sf from college.

the place is a-hole-in-the-wall--and it only adds character, especially since it's a local restaurant.
and the food was greasy--but what comfort food isn't?

yeah. i'd go here again.
author: Victoria N.

description: As far as hole in the wall places go, this one beats the rest in being the most obscure. The outside is very unassuming, but inside, the little dingy, slightly unkempt place is usually packed with people eating or waiting for their to go orders. Most of the people who eat there are filipino so I guess that's a good sign while the staff is chinese. My coworkers love the food there and rave about it, but me, not so much. It's super cheap, but the quality is also cheap. You ask, well what do you expect? I know some places that have cheap prices, but good quality eats as well. I'd rather frequent those joints. The food here is greasy and dry. I might be biased because I don't really like filipino breakfasts which is the main dry here, but I've had better filipino breakfasts at other places in the neighborhood.
author: Jenny W.

description: Breakfast is craaazy good! Hong Kong style pork chop and tapa! wow. good eats and GREAT PRICES! You can feed two and be satisfied for under $10 !!!!!
author: Oh So Fresh B.

description: For under $5 you can get Hong Kong style pork chops served with garlic fried rice, a fried egg, chopped tomatoes and a can soda.  Awesome!  This place looks shady, but the food is good and affordable.
author: Randy M.

description:
2 longanisas, an egg, garlic fried rice, pineapples or tomatoes with a fried chicken leg for less than $5?!?!?!?! I'm there! I've been going to this place for over 10 years and all I can say is that I know I will be back for all the years to come!

Thumbs up all the way!
author: Julie W.

description:
when i miss san francisco, i know what i'm missing are three things: ocean taqueria, mr chan's (in daly city), and this place.

it's a cheap hole in the wall with yummyass food.  gotta love the crispiness of the pork chop and fried chicken.  and the garlic fried rice....i'm getting hungry.

don't go here so we can keep the prices low! hahaha
author: vanessa e.

description: Superstar is the best, the food is great, price is very affordable.And the stuff are friendly.
author: Jo G.

description: If you are broke, this is a place to go to fill you up, but if you eat here every day, you will gain 5 pounds in 1 week, guaranteed, cause that's what happened to me when I ate here like 5 times in 1 week.
author: James C.

description:
Super Stars located on Mission Street is a great place to eat if your on a budget. The food at Super Stars is really cheap because all of the meals on the menu probably cost around four dollars or less. The food is served in a pretty large portion for the price that it is. Each dish is served with garlic fried rice, eggs, tomatoes or pineapples, and then your main dish. Some of  the main dishes that are served at this location are Hong Kong style porkchops, tilapia, bangus, tapa, longanesa, and fried chicken. I recommend getting the Hong Kong style porkchops because they're good, and they serve it to you in a very large portion. I also enjoy eating the other dishes, but the porkchops are my favorite. The food is also kind of greasy, especially the garlic fried rice, but i still think its good.

The food is great at this restaurant, but the surroundings and the area to sit is kind of dirty. There are not that many tables in this restaurant and only a limited amount of seats. Each table has four chairs, but if four people were to sit in one table then it would be cramped. There is also barely any space between you and the table behind you, and this makes it very hard to back out of your seat. The sitting area in general is very small, and I would recommend taking the food to-go. You are also not allowed to take your food to-go and eat at the tables because there are no garbage cans in this restaurant. If you eat you food there, then they serve it to you in a plate, not in a plastic container. I also think the cups that they serve your water seem dirty, so i don't recommend asking for a cup of water. I also think that the bathroom is dirty, and should be cleaned more thoroughly.

I would consider this restaurant to be fast food because after you order you would probably receive your food within five to ten minutes. They are really fast and quick when they make your meals, but it still tastes delicious.

I would definitely recommend Super Stars to all audiences if they enjoy Chinese/Filipino food. It's a great place to eat for breakfast, and maybe even lunch or dinner. I would definitely recommend this place to starving college students like me that are on a tight budget. You could get a large meal that could get you really full for under four dollars. These meals are authentic home cooked meals if you long for those meals that your mom makes. This would probably be the same price if you were to eat at a McDonald's, but Super Stars is a lot better. It's a good hang out place for a large, cheap, and tasty meal.
author: Bryan T.

description: Not for me! After I ate their food, I had a major stomach ache the whole day. Small space. Cheap yes, but not worth the bathroom sickness.
author: christine d.

description: garlic fried rice and hong kong style pork chop! yummy in my tummy. cheap and good. what else can you ask for?! i will more than likely to be back!
author: Valerie N.

description: good food! good service! cheap price! what more can you ask for! great place to go if your around there and only have $3.00 and couple of change. it will fill you up.
author: John B.

description: I'll tell you right now...or should I say warn...? This place defines a hole in the wall kinda restaurant but at the same time...probably the cheapest damn breakfast food you can order...filipino at that and I LOVE hearty and greasy Filipino breakfasts! You order one thing for yourself and you won't spend no more than $3! Can you believe that!? You get loads of greasy sininag, a side of pineapples, fried itlog (eggs) and the ulam (dish) of your choosing where it be tocino, tapa, chicken, you name it! I still prefer good ole Ling Nam's Filipino breakfast over this place but you still can't beat the prices here. 2 breakfast meals here is the cost of one meal at Ling Nam. It's funny if you eat inside though. You better not lie about taking it out when your eating inside because they are so cheap about the containers for take out that they get mad at you if you end up eating inside when you say for take out. I wouldn't recommend eating inside anyways.
author: Sean E.

description: This place tops my Hole-In-The-Wall list.  If you have three bucks, you can get a nice Filipino breakfast here... I especially like the Hong Kong style fried pork chops.  You will have cholesterol and MSG running through your veins for days!  However, they do fry the rice with toasted garlic to make it a bit healthy.  This place is great for those once-in-a-while urges to eat something really greasy for breakfast, lunch or dinner...especially when you're broke and feel like eating out. This place is popular with Filipinos, but the cooks are Chinese.
author: Raging R.

description:
this place is not cute.   it is not clean.  it's cheap but it'll kill ya! 

sure it brings back memories of early college days but thats not enough to give it more stars!!  that just means you went there so many times youve grown an attachment but for reviews sake... that just doesnt work for me, haha.  

anyway it got two stars because if you take out, youll fully enjoy your food... just try not to think of how uncute/unclean this place is.
author: Aubrey M.

description: looking for a quick cheap food?superstar is the best.well for us asian this  is a must to go coz is cheap and dammit the portion of the food is huge just dont look on the ambiance
author: jack s.

description: I bought lunch for my department today since I hit one the football pools this weekend.  What better place to go then to Super Star.  Lunch is very affordable especially when feeding large groups of people.  I bought 10 lunches for $38.00.  9 Hong Kong style Pork Chops and 1 smoked boneless bangus.  Usually when coworkers order from here I just place my order and they go pick it up.  This time I went to the establishment and picked up the orders.  This is not a place you want to eat at.  Call it in "To Go" and have someone else pick it up for you.  The place is small, crowded, not clean at all.  So why eat here? Because its that darn good and cheap.  The rice can be a bit hard at times but I think its because its steamed first and then fried with garlic and the rice turns a bit crunchy or stale like.  I had the bangus(milk fish) rice and 2 eggs.  The eggs are always over cooked and I wish they could come a bit more runny.  I think it just carries on the cooking while packed and by the time it arrives the office its over cooked.  The fish is always good, perfect smokiness and no bones at all. Drizzle a bit of vinegar and enjoy with the egg and garlic rice.  You cant beat the prices and the yummy food.  Just have someone else go pick it up and you will enjoy this typical Filipino breakfast/lunch specials.
author: David P.

description: the food is extremely cheap there. especially fillipino food i havent been there in a while but i am pretty sure the prices hasnt changed. its probably still 2.20 for fillipino breakfast. most of the time i get the porkchop with garlic fried rice and pineapple. with egg. or you can get the chicken. and its only 3.20 thats including tax. the food is cheap but for you "rich uptight people" its really bad. most of the time theirs ghetto people there like those hyphy kids. and generally you get all kinds of nationalitys there. but thats not why i go there. its when i am really broke. and i want food that will fill me up.
author: Nicholas Y.

description: I suppose people who grew up with silver spoons or camping out at the local suburban mall would find this place disgusting as most hole in the walls are, but personally I love this place.  The food is great and for a starving student just getting out of afternoon class, you can not beat the price.  Keep it up super star, im a customer for life... and dont trip, Ling Nam cant fade you guys.
author: eddo l.

description: the place is one of the best places i've eaten at. the garlic fried rice is perfect. not too strong or salty, HK style pork chops are the way to go. they're like the size of my head. Fried chicken there is huge and delicious. all for under 4 dollars too!?!? crazy!?! yes its dirty, but those are the best places to get food at
author: Preston L.
